member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalNavigationBar.AddGroup(PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber,PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber,PPJ.Runtime.SalString,PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber)
member.summary: Adds a new group to the specified pane of a navigation bar.

remarks.para: See PixelsToFormUnits() or FormUnitsToPixels() for information about the "form unit". If the group is added before an existing group, the group that follows the new group will resize smaller to accommodate the new group. If the new group is appended, the group that immediately precedes the new group will resize smaller. If this does not provide enough space, the next group will be resized as well. For example, if the newly added group (group A) has a height of 200, and the group preceding it (group B) has a height of 100, group B will shrink to a height of 0, and the group that immediately precedes group B (group C) will have its height reduced by 100.

Note: When controls appear above the first defined group separator in a navigation pane, they are categorized as "ungrouped" controls. The controls that appear after the first separator belong to group zero. The controls that appear after the second separator belong to group one. If = 0, the new group will appear immediately above the current group zero, and below any "ungrouped" controls.

member.param: Zero-based index of the pane to which you want to add a group.
Zero-based index that the new group will occupy.
The title of the new group.
The height of the new group in form units.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds, false if an error occurs.

member.summary: Removes a group from the navigation bar control.

member.returns: true if the function succeeds, false if it fails.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalNavigationBar.SaveState(PPJ.Runtime.SalString@)
member.summary: Saves the settings of a navigation bar to an XML string.
member.remarks:
Information saved includes:
-Navigation bar expanded or collapsed.
-Number of buttons visible in the navigation bar.
-Enabled panes and disabled panes.
-Sequence of the panes.
-Current(selected) pane.
-States of the groups(expanded or collapsed) in the current pane.
member.param: Receives the string where the state is saved.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds, false if it fails (for example, as a result of an invalid control).

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalNavigationBar.LoadState(PPJ.Runtime.SalString)
member.summary: Restore the settings of a navigation bar from an XML string.
member.remarks:
Information restored includes:
-Navigation bar expanded or collapsed.
-Number of buttons visible in the navigation bar.
-Enabled panes and disabled panes.
-Sequence of the panes.
-Current(selected) pane.
-States of the groups(expanded or collapsed) in the current pane.
member.param: The string where the state is saved.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds, false if it fails (for example, as a result of an invalid window control).

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalNavigationBar.CenterWindow
member.summary: Centers a window. If the window is a top-level window, it centers it on the desktop. If the window is a child window, it centers it on top of its parent.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalNavigationBar.SetContextMenu(PPJ.Runtime.SalString,PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber)
member.summary: Defines a named popup menu that displays automatically when a window receives SAM_ContextMenu.
member.remarks: For some windows, this function also affects how the window processes a right mouse button click: List box-Right click selects the line under the cursor.If the line is already selected, there is no effect. Combo box-For a combo box where the list is always displayed, the behavior is the same as for a list box. Table window-Right click selects the row under the cursor. If the row is already selected there is no effect.
member.param: A named menu defined in one of the Named Menus section in the control, its MDI window parent, or Global Declarations.
Set this to to replace the default menu that Windows displays when the mouse pointer is in an editable table window cell. Otherwise, set this to zero.
member.returns: true if this function succeeds and false otherwise.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalNavigationBar.SetContextMenu(System.Type,PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber)
member.summary: Defines a named popup menu that displays automatically when a window receives SAM_ContextMenu.
member.param: the of the menu
Set this to to replace the default menu that Windows displays when the mouse pointer is in an editable table window cell. Otherwise, set this to zero.
member.returns: true if this function succeeds and false otherwise.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalNavigationBar.FormUnitsToPixels(PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber,PPJ.Runtime.SalBoolean)
member.summary: Computes the number of pixels in the number of form units. Form units are a unit of measurement used by functions which move and position objects. Form units are computed using physical units (pixels) in conjunction with the window's font size.
member.param: The number of form units.
If the form units are on the X axis, set this parameter to false. If the form units are on the Y axis, set this parameter to true.
member.returns: the number of pixels if the function succeeds. Returns zero (0) if the control is invalid.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalNavigationBar.GetFirstChild(PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber)
member.summary: Returns the handle of the first child window of the specified type. You can use this function to get the handles of MDI child windows.

remarks.para: Window types:

and are statistics by default and not implemented as windows. If you want this function to work for lines and frames set the system variable bStaticsAsWindows to TRUE. This is a global system variable, so the setting persists until it is changed.

member.param: One or more window types combined (using the OR (|) operator) to create a mask of child window types.
member.returns: the first child window of the specified type. Returns if there is no child window or if the control is invalid.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalNavigationBar.GetNextChild(PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber)
member.summary: Returns the handle of the next child window that matches a specified type.

remarks.para: Window types:

Use this function after calling GetFirstChild() to get the other child window siblings. You can use this function to get the handles of MDI child windows. If you want this function to work for lines and frames, set the system variable bStaticsAsWindows to true. This is a global system variable, so the setting persists until you change it.

member.param: One or more window types combined (using the OR (|) operator) to create a mask of child window types.
member.returns: the next child window of the specified type. Returns if there is no child window or if the window is invalid.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalNavigationBar.SetText(PPJ.Runtime.SalString)
member.summary: Sets the text of a window.
member.remarks: A window's text is the title of a form window, modeless dialog box, table window, radio button, check box, or push button. For a data field or table window column, the text is the object's value in string form, regardless of the object's data type. For a combo box, the text is the contents of the editable data field portion.If the combo box is not editable, it tries to set the list selection to the item that matches the specified string. This latter statement is true for list boxes as well.
member.param: The window text.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if it fails.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalNavigationBar.ShowWindow
member.summary: Makes a window visible.
member.returns: true if the previous state of the window was visible and false if it was hidden. Use this information to hide many windows without first checking that they are visible. When you restore them to their original state at a later point in time, the return lets you make visible only those windows that were previously visible.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalNavigationBar.KillTimer(PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber)
member.summary: Destroys an object's system timer.
member.remarks: Set a system timer with the function. Note: Timers are a limited global resource. Your application must check the value returned by to verify that the timer was created.
member.param: The timer ID to kill.
member.returns: true if the event is successfully killed and false if the specified timer cannot be found.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalNavigationBar.SetTimer(PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber,PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber)
member.summary: Creates a system timer for a given object. When a timer event occurs, sends messages to the object in specified intervals. Timers are a limited global resource. Your application must check the value returned by SalTimerSet to verify that the timer was created.
member.param: The timer ID number.
The elapsed time between each message, in milliseconds.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if it fails.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalNavigationBar.TrackPopupMenu(PPJ.Runtime.SalString,PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber,PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber,PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber)
member.summary: Creates pop-up menus at runtime.
member.remarks: Possible flag values:
member.param: The name of a pop-up menu accessible to the owner. For example, a menu defined by the owner or its MDI window parent, or a global menu.
Specifies how the pop-up menu displays. You can combine flag values using the OR (|) operator.
The position of the pop-up menu on the X axis. The value of this parameter is ignored if you set the flag in flags.

The position of the pop-up menu on the Y axis. The value of this parameter is ignored if you set the in flags. The x and y Parameters together represent a point (the top left, top middle, or top right) of the pop-up menu, depending on the flags value.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if it fails.

Specifies how the pop-up menu displays. You can combine flag values using the OR (|) operator.
The position of the pop-up menu on the X axis. The value of this parameter is ignored if you set the flag in flags.

The position of the pop-up menu on the Y axis. The value of this parameter is ignored if you set the in flags. The x and y Parameters together represent a point (the top left, top middle, or top right) of the pop-up menu, depending on the flags value.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if it fails.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalNavigationBar.UpdateWindow
member.summary: Forces the update of a window.
member.remarks: Painting is a low priority. Paint messages are sent to the end of an object's message queue and are processed after all other messages in the queue. If, during the development phase of your application, you find that painting is being delayed, you can force a window to update.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if the window is not valid.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalNavigationBar.IsDerivedFromClass(System.Type)
member.summary: Determines whether a window is an instance of the specified class.
member.remarks: Tells you if a window is an instance of the class that you specify or an instance of a class that is derived from the class that you specify. Call this function to determine if you can make a late-bound call to a function defined in the named class using the window handle that you specify. If you make a late-bound function call with a handle that is not for a window derived from the named class and the function returns a value, you get an error at runtime and the application ends.
member.param: The class type. Not a string. Type the class name without single quotes.
member.returns: true if the window is an instance of the named class or an instance of a class that is derived from the named class.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalTreeControl.SetContextMenu(PPJ.Runtime.SalString,PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber)
member.summary: Defines a named popup menu that displays automatically when a window receives .
member.remarks: For some windows, this function also affects how the window processes a right mouse button click: List box-Right click selects the line under the cursor.If the line is already selected, there is no effect. Combo box-For a combo box where the list is always displayed, the behavior is the same as for a list box. Table window-Right click selects the row under the cursor. If the row is already selected there is no effect.
member.param: A named menu defined in one of the Named Menus section in the control, its MDI window parent, or Global Declarations.
Set this to to replace the default menu that Windows displays when the mouse pointer is in an editable table window cell. Otherwise, set this to zero.
member.returns: true if this function succeeds and false otherwise.

member.returns: true if this function succeeds and false otherwise.

member.param: The number of form units.
If the form units are on the X axis, set this parameter to false. If the form units are on the Y axis, set this parameter to true.
member.returns: the number of pixels if the function succeeds. Returns zero (0) if the control is invalid.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalTreeControl.GetFirstChild(PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber)
member.summary: Returns the handle of the first child window of the specified type. You can use this function to get the handles of MDI child windows.

remarks.para: Window types:

and are statistics by default and not implemented as windows. If you want this function to work for lines and frames set the system variable bStaticsAsWindows to TRUE. This is a global system variable, so the setting persists until it is changed.

member.param: One or more window types combined (using the OR (|) operator) to create a mask of child window types.
member.returns: the first child window of the specified type. Returns if there is no child window or if the control is invalid.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalTreeControl.GetNextChild(PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber)
member.summary: Returns the handle of the next child window that matches a specified type.

remarks.para: Window types:

Use this function after calling GetFirstChild() to get the other child window siblings. You can use this function to get the handles of MDI child windows. If you want this function to work for lines and frames, set the system variable bStaticsAsWindows to true. This is a global system variable, so the setting persists until you change it.

member.param: One or more window types combined (using the OR (|) operator) to create a mask of child window types.
member.returns: the next child window of the specified type. Returns if there is no child window or if the control is invalid.

member.summary: Sets the text of a window.
member.remarks: A window's text is the title of a form window, modeless dialog box, table window, radio button, check box, or push button. For a data field or table window column, the text is the object's value in string form, regardless of the object's data type. For a combo box, the text is the contents of the editable data field portion.If the combo box is not editable, it tries to set the list selection to the item that matches the specified string. This latter statement is true for list boxes as well. SetWindowText() clears the field edit flag.
member.param: The window text.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if it fails.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalTreeControl.ShowWindow
member.summary: Makes a window visible.
member.returns: true if the previous state of the window was visible and false if it was hidden. Use this information to hide many windows without first checking that they are visible. When you restore them to their original state at a later point in time, the return lets you make visible only those windows that were previously visible.

member.summary: Destroys an object's system timer.

member.returns: true if the event is successfully killed and false if the specified timer cannot be found.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalTreeControl.SetTimer(PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber,PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber)

member.param: The timer ID number.
The elapsed time between each message, in milliseconds.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if it fails.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalTreeControl.TrackPopupMenu(PPJ.Runtime.SalString,PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber,PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber,PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber)
member.summary: Creates pop-up menus at runtime.
member.remarks: Possible flag values:
member.param: The name of a pop-up menu accessible to the control.. For example, a menu defined by the contrpl or its MDI window parent, or a global menu.
Specifies how the pop-up menu displays. You can combine flag values using the OR (|) operator.
The position of the pop-up menu on the X axis. The value of this parameter is ignored if you set the flag in flags.

The position of the pop-up menu on the Y axis. The value of this parameter is ignored if you set the in flags. The x and y Parameters together represent a point (the top left, top middle, or top right) of the pop-up menu, depending on the flags value.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if it fails.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalTreeControl.IsDerivedFromClass(System.Type)
member.summary: Determines whether a window is an instance of the specified class.
member.remarks: Tells you if a window is an instance of the class that you specify or an instance of a class that is derived from the class that you specify. Call this function to determine if you can make a late-bound call to a function defined in the named class using the window handle that you specify. If you make a late-bound function call with a handle that is not for a window derived from the named class and the function returns a value, you get an error at runtime and the application ends.
member.param: The class type. Not a string. Type the class name without single quotes.
member.returns: true if the window is an instance of the named class or an instance of a class that is derived from the named class.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalTreeControl.SetModified(PPJ.Runtime.SalBoolean)
member.summary: Sets or clears the field edit flag for an editable data field, combo box, multi line text field, table window column, or picture.
member.remarks: The Field Edit Flag is set whenever the user changes the value of a data field, multiline field, combo box or table window column. For a picture, the field edit flag is set whenever a server application is opened for editing. The field edit flag is not set if you make the change with a Set statement or a fetch from a database.
member.param: true sets the flag; false clears it.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if it fails.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalTreeControl.IsModified
member.summary: Returns the setting of the Field Edit Flag for a data field, multi line field, combo box, table window's context row cell, or picture.

remarks.para: The field edit flag is set whenever the user changes the value of an editable data field, multiline text field, or table window column. For a picture, the field edit flag is set whenever a server application is opened for editing. The field edit flag is not set if you make the change with a Set statement or a fetch from the database.
This function does NOT clear the field edit flag of the control.

member.returns: true if the control's field edit flag is set and false otherwise.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalTreeControl.Clear
member.summary: Clears the value from a data field, multi line field, or table window column.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalTreeControl.GetLabel
member.summary: Retrieves the window handle of the label (label control) that is associated with the hWndTarget parameter. There must be a mnemonic in that label, and it must immediately precede hWndTarget in the outline, or this function will fail.
member.returns: The Label Control associated with the control

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalTreeControl.DisableWindowAndLabel
member.summary: Disables keyboard and mouse input to a window and grays out its associated label. A label is the label control that immediately precedes the window in the outline. The label control must have a mnemonic. If the window contains text (for example, a push button), the text is grayed. If the window is a data field, it cannot receive the focus.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if it fails.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalTreeControl.EnableWindowAndLabel
member.summary: Enables keyboard and mouse input to a window and enables its associated label as well. A label is the label control that immediately precedes the window in the outline.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if it fails.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalTreeControl.ShowWindowAndLabel
member.summary: Makes a window and its associated label visible. A label is the label control that immediately precedes the window in the outline.
member.returns: true if the previous state of the window was visible and false if it was hidden. Use this information to hide many windows without first checking that they are visible. When you restore them to their original state at a later point in time, the return lets you make visible only those windows that were previously visible.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalTreeControl.HideWindowAndLabel
member.summary: Hides a window and its associated label.
member.remarks: A label is the background text that immediately precedes the window in the outline. This function does not destroy the window; it only makes the window invisible.
member.returns: true if the previous state of the window was visible and false if it was hidden. Use this information to hide many windows without first checking that they are visible. When you restore them to their original state at a later point in time, the return lets you make visible only those windows that were previously visible.

member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if it fails.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalActiveX.GetNextChild(PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber)
member.summary: Returns the handle of the next child window that matches a specified type.

remarks.para: Window types:

Use this function after calling to get the other child window siblings. You can use this function to get the handles of MDI child windows. If you want this function to work for lines and frames, set the system variable bStaticsAsWindows to true. This is a global system variable, so the setting persists until you change it.

member.param: One or more window types combined (using the OR (|) operator) to create a mask of child window types.
member.returns: the next child window of the specified type. Returns if there is no child window or if hWndChild is invalid.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalActiveX.SetText(PPJ.Runtime.SalString)
member.summary: Sets the text of a window.
member.remarks: A window's text is the title of a form window, modeless dialog box, table window, radio button, check box, or push button. For a data field or table window column, the text is the object's value in string form, regardless of the object's data type. For a combo box, the text is the contents of the editable data field portion.If the combo box is not editable, it tries to set the list selection to the item that matches the specified string. This latter statement is true for list boxes as well. clears the field edit flag.
member.param: The window text.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if it fails.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalActiveX.ShowWindow
member.summary: Makes a window visible.
member.returns: true if the previous state of the window was visible and false if it was hidden. Use this information to hide many windows without first checking that they are visible. When you restore them to their original state at a later point in time, the return lets you make visible only those windows that were previously visible.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalActiveX.SetTimer(PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber,PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber)
member.summary: Creates a system timer for a given object. When a timer event occurs, sends SAM_Timer messages to the object in specified intervals. Timers are a limited global resource. Your application must check the value returned by SalTimerSet to verify that the timer was created.
member.param: The timer ID number.
The elapsed time between each message, in milliseconds.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if it fails.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalActiveX.TrackPopupMenu(PPJ.Runtime.SalString,PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber,PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber,PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber)
member.summary: Creates pop-up menus at runtime.
member.param: The name of a pop-up menu accessible to owner. For example, a menu defined by owner or its MDI window parent, or a global menu.
Specifies how the pop-up menu displays. You can combine flag values using the OR (|) operator.
The position of the pop-up menu on the X axis. The value of this parameter is ignored if you set the flag in flags.

The position of the pop-up menu on the Y axis. The value of this parameter is ignored if you set the in flags. The x and y Parameters together represent a point (the top left, top middle, or top right) of the pop-up menu, depending on the flags value.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if it fails.

The position of the pop-up menu on the Y axis. The value of this parameter is ignored if you set the in flags. The x and y Parameters together represent a point (the top left, top middle, or top right) of the pop-up menu, depending on the flags value.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if it fails.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalActiveX.UpdateWindow
member.summary: Forces the update of a window.
member.remarks: Painting is a low priority. Paint messages are sent to the end of an object's message queue and are processed after all other messages in the queue. If, during the development phase of your application, you find that painting is being delayed, you can force a window to update.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if the window that called this function is not a valid window.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalActiveX.IsDerivedFromClass(System.Type)
member.summary: Determines whether a window is an instance of the specified class.
member.remarks: Tells you if a window is an instance of the class that you specify or an instance of a class that is derived from the class that you specify. Call this function to determine if you can make a late-bound call to a function defined in the named class using the window handle that you specify. If you make a late-bound function call with a handle that is not for a window derived from the named class and the function returns a value, you get an error at runtime and the application ends.
member.param: The class type. Not a string. Type the class name without single quotes.
member.returns: true if the window is an instance of the named class or an instance of a class that is derived from the named class.

member.param: The name of a pop-up menu accessible to the window that called this function. For example, a menu defined by the window that called this function or its MDI window parent, or a global menu.
Specifies how the pop-up menu displays. You can combine flag values using the OR (|) operator.
The position of the pop-up menu on the X axis. The value of this parameter is ignored if you set the flag in flags.

The position of the pop-up menu on the Y axis. The value of this parameter is ignored if you set the in flags. The x and y Parameters together represent a point (the top left, top middle, or top right) of the pop-up menu, depending on the flags value.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if it fails.

member.remarks: Possible flag values:
member.param: The type of a pop-up menu accessible to the window that called this function.
Specifies how the pop-up menu displays. You can combine flag values using the OR (|) operator.
The position of the pop-up menu on the X axis. The value of this parameter is ignored if you set the flag in flags.

The position of the pop-up menu on the Y axis. The value of this parameter is ignored if you set the in flags. The x and y Parameters together represent a point (the top left, top middle, or top right) of the pop-up menu, depending on the flags value.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if it fails.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalCheckBox.UpdateWindow
member.summary: Forces the update of a window.
member.remarks: Painting is a low priority. Paint messages are sent to the end of an object's message queue and are processed after all other messages in the queue. If, during the development phase of your application, you find that painting is being delayed, you can force a window to update.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if the window that called this function is not valid.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalCheckBox.IsDerivedFromClass(System.Type)
member.summary: Determines whether a window is an instance of the specified class.
member.remarks: Tells you if a window is an instance of the class that you specify or an instance of a class that is derived from the class that you specify. Call this function to determine if you can make a late-bound call to a function defined in the named class using the window handle that you specify. If you make a late-bound function call with a handle that is not for a window derived from the named class and the function returns a value, you get an error at runtime and the application ends.
member.param: The class type. Not a string. Type the class name without single quotes.
member.returns: true if the window is an instance of the named class or an instance of a class that is derived from the named class.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalCheckBox.SetModified(PPJ.Runtime.SalBoolean)
member.summary: Sets or clears the field edit flag for an editable data field, combo box, multi line text field, table window column, or picture.
member.remarks: The Field Edit Flag is set whenever the user changes the value of a data field, multiline field, combo box or table window column. For a picture, the field edit flag is set whenever a server application is opened for editing. The field edit flag is not set if you make the change with a Set statement or a fetch from a database.
member.param: true sets the flag; false clears it.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if it fails.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalCheckBox.IsModified
member.summary: Returns the setting of the Field Edit Flag for a data field, multi line field, combo box, table window's context row cell, or picture.

remarks.para: The field edit flag is set whenever the user changes the value of an editable data field, multiline text field, or table window column. For a picture, the field edit flag is set whenever a server application is opened for editing. The field edit flag is not set if you make the change with a Set statement or a fetch from the database.
This function does NOT clear the field edit flag of the window.

member.returns: true if the field edit flag is set and false otherwise.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalCheckBox.GetLabel
member.summary: Retrieves the window handle of the label (label control) that is associated with the hWndTarget parameter. There must be a mnemonic in that label, and it must immediately precede hWndTarget in the outline, or this function will fail.
member.returns: The Label Control associated with the window that called this function.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalCheckBox.DisableWindowAndLabel
member.summary: Disables keyboard and mouse input to a window and grays out its associated label. A label is the label control that immediately precedes the window in the outline. The label control must have a mnemonic. If the window contains text (for example, a push button), the text is grayed. If the window is a data field, it cannot receive the focus.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if it fails.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalCheckBox.EnableWindowAndLabel
member.summary: Enables keyboard and mouse input to a window and enables its associated label as well. A label is the label control that immediately precedes the window in the outline.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if it fails.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalCheckBox.ShowWindowAndLabel
member.summary: Makes a window and its associated label visible. A label is the label control that immediately precedes the window in the outline.
member.returns: true if the previous state of the window was visible and false if it was hidden. Use this information to hide many windows without first checking that they are visible. When you restore them to their original state at a later point in time, the return lets you make visible only those windows that were previously visible.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalCheckBox.HideWindowAndLabel
member.summary: Hides a window and its associated label.
member.remarks: A label is the background text that immediately precedes the window in the outline. This function does not destroy the window; it only makes the window invisible.
member.returns: true if the previous state of the window was visible and false if it was hidden. Use this information to hide many windows without first checking that they are visible. When you restore them to their original state at a later point in time, the return lets you make visible only those windows that were previously visible.

member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if it fails.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalComboBox.FormUnitsToPixels(PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber,PPJ.Runtime.SalBoolean)
member.summary: Computes the number of pixels in the number of form units. Form units are a unit of measurement used by functions which move and position objects. Form units are computed using physical units (pixels) in conjunction with the window's font size.
member.param: The number of form units.
If the form units are on the X axis, set this parameter to false. If the form units are on the Y axis, set this parameter to true.
member.returns: the number of pixels if the function succeeds. Returns zero (0) if the window that called this function is invalid.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalComboBox.GetFirstChild(PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber)
member.summary: Returns the handle of the first child window of the specified type. You can use this function to get the handles of MDI child windows.

remarks.para: Window types:

and are statistics by default and not implemented as windows. If you want this function to work for lines and frames set the system variable bStaticsAsWindows to TRUE. This is a global system variable, so the setting persists until it is changed.

member.param: One or more window types combined (using the OR (|) operator) to create a mask of child window types.
member.returns: the first child window of the specified type. Returns if there is no child window or if the window that called this function is invalid.

Use this function after calling to get the other child window siblings. You can use this function to get the handles of MDI child windows. If you want this function to work for lines and frames, set the system variable bStaticsAsWindows to true. This is a global system variable, so the setting persists until you change it.

member.param: One or more window types combined (using the OR (|) operator) to create a mask of child window types.

For a combo box, the text is the contents of the editable data field portion.If the combo box is not editable, it tries to set the list selection to the item that matches the specified string. member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalComboBox.IsDerivedFromClass(System.Type)
member.summary: Determines whether a window is an instance of the specified class.
member.remarks: Tells you if a window is an instance of the class that you specify or an instance of a class that is derived from the class that you specify. Call this function to determine if you can make a late-bound call to a function defined in the named class using the window handle that you specify. If you make a late-bound function call with a handle that is not for a window derived from the named class and the function returns a value, you get an error at runtime and the application ends.
member.param: The class type. Not a string. Type the class name without single quotes.
member.returns: true if the window is an instance of the named class or an instance of a class that is derived from the named class.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalComboBox.SetModified(PPJ.Runtime.SalBoolean)
member.summary: Sets or clears the field edit flag for an editable data field, combo box, multi line text field, table window column, or picture.
member.remarks: The Field Edit Flag is set whenever the user changes the value of a data field, multiline field, combo box or table window column. For a picture, the field edit flag is set whenever a server application is opened for editing. The field edit flag is not set if you make the change with a Set statement or a fetch from a database.
member.param: true sets the flag; false clears it.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if it fails.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalComboBox.IsModified
member.summary: Returns the setting of the Field Edit Flag for a data field, multi line field, combo box, table window's context row cell, or picture.

remarks.para: The field edit flag is set whenever the user changes the value of an editable data field, multiline text field, or table window column. For a picture, the field edit flag is set whenever a server application is opened for editing. The field edit flag is not set if you make the change with a Set statement or a fetch from the database.
This function does NOT clear the field edit flag of the window.

member.returns: true if the field edit flag is set and false otherwise.

member.summary: Disables keyboard and mouse input to a window and grays out its associated label. A label is the label control that immediately precedes the window in the outline. When you restore them to their original state at a later point in time, the return lets you make visible only those windows that were previously visible.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalComboBox.HideWindowAndLabel

member.summary: Populates a list box or combo box with a result set. SalListPopulate overrides any settings made with SalListSetTabs. If the SELECT statement returns data from multiple columns, each column's data displayed in a list box is separated by tabs. However, due to a Microsoft Windows limitation, each column's data displayed in a combo box is separated by a single '|' character. There is no space between one column's data, the separator character, and another column's data.
member.param: A to execute the command.
SQL command to execute.
SQL error handler callback.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if any of the parameters are invalid or if contains INTO variables.

member.summary: Sets tabs in a list box.
member.remarks: List boxes use tabs to align columns of data. You need to set tabs when you are using a proportional font. Note: Since SalListPopulate overrides any settings made with SalListSetTabs, call SalListSetTabs (to set tabs) after you populate a list box using SalListPopulate.Note that you can use SalListSetTabs (to set tab stops) after you populate using SalListPopulate.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalCustomControl.FormUnitsToPixels(PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber,PPJ.Runtime.SalBoolean)
member.summary: Computes the number of pixels in the number of form units. Form units are a unit of measurement used by functions which move and position objects. Form units are computed using physical units (pixels) in conjunction with the window's font size.
member.param: The number of form units.
If the form units are on the X axis, set this parameter to false. If the form units are on the Y axis, set this parameter to true.
member.returns: the number of pixels if the function succeeds. Returns zero (0) if the window that called this function is invalid.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalCustomControl.GetFirstChild(PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber)
member.summary: Returns the handle of the first child window of the specified type. You can use this function to get the handles of MDI child windows.

remarks.para: Window types:

and are statistics by default and not implemented as windows. If you want this function to work for lines and frames set the system variable bStaticsAsWindows to TRUE. This is a global system variable, so the setting persists until it is changed.

member.param: One or more window types combined (using the OR (|) operator) to create a mask of child window types.
member.returns: the first child window of the specified type. Returns if there is no child window or if the window that called this function is invalid.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalCustomControl.GetNextChild(PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber)
member.summary: Returns the handle of the next child window that matches a specified type.

remarks.para: Window types:

Use this function after calling to get the other child window siblings. You can use this function to get the handles of MDI child windows. If you want this function to work for lines and frames, set the system variable bStaticsAsWindows to true. This is a global system variable, so the setting persists until you change it.

member.param: One or more window types combined (using the OR (|) operator) to create a mask of child window types.
member.returns: the next child window of the specified type. Returns if there is no child window or if the window that called this function is invalid.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalCustomControl.SetText(PPJ.Runtime.SalString)
member.summary: Sets the text of a window.
member.remarks: A window's text is the title of a form window, modeless dialog box, table window, radio button, check box, or push button. For a data field or table window column, the text is the object's value in string form, regardless of the object's data type. For a combo box, the text is the contents of the editable data field portion.If the combo box is not editable, it tries to set the list selection to the item that matches the specified string. This latter statement is true for list boxes as well.
member.param: The window text.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if it fails.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalCustomControl.ShowWindow
member.summary: Makes a window visible.
member.returns: true if the previous state of the window was visible and false if it was hidden. Use this information to hide many windows without first checking that they are visible. When you restore them to their original state at a later point in time, the return lets you make visible only those windows that were previously visible.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalCustomControl.KillTimer(PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber)
member.summary: Destroys an object's system timer. Removes any pending messages from the message queue of the object.
member.remarks: Set a system timer with the function. Note: Timers are a limited global resource. Your application must check the value returned by to verify that the timer was created.
member.param: The timer ID to kill.
member.returns: true if the event is successfully killed and false if the specified timer cannot be found.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalCustomControl.SetTimer(PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber,PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber)
member.summary: Creates a system timer for a given object. When a timer event occurs, sends messages to the object in specified intervals. Timers are a limited global resource. Your application must check the value returned by SetTimer() to verify that the timer was created.
member.param: The timer ID number.
The elapsed time between each message, in milliseconds.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if it fails.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalCustomControl.TrackPopupMenu(System.Type,PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber,PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber,PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber)
member.summary: Creates pop-up menus at runtime.
member.remarks: Possible flag values:
member.param: The type of a pop-up menu accessible to the window that called this function.
Specifies how the pop-up menu displays. You can combine flag values using the OR (|) operator.
The position of the pop-up menu on the X axis. The value of this parameter is ignored if you set the flag in flags.

The position of the pop-up menu on the Y axis. The value of this parameter is ignored if you set the in flags. The x and y Parameters together represent a point (the top left, top middle, or top right) of the pop-up menu, depending on the flags value.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if it fails.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalCustomControl.UpdateWindow
member.summary: Forces the update of a window.
member.remarks: Painting is a low priority. Paint messages are sent to the end of an object's message queue and are processed after all other messages in the queue. If, during the development phase of your application, you find that painting is being delayed, you can force a window to update.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if the window that called this function is not valid.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalCustomControl.IsDerivedFromClass(System.Type)
member.summary: Determines whether a window is an instance of the specified class.
member.remarks: Tells you if a window is an instance of the class that you specify or an instance of a class that is derived from the class that you specify. Call this function to determine if you can make a late-bound call to a function defined in the named class using the window handle that you specify. If you make a late-bound function call with a handle that is not for a window derived from the named class and the function returns a value, you get an error at runtime and the application ends.
member.param: The class type. Not a string. Type the class name without single quotes.
member.returns: true if the window is an instance of the named class or an instance of a class that is derived from the named class.

member.summary: Computes the number of pixels in the number of form units. Form units are a unit of measurement used by functions which move and position objects. Form units are computed using physical units (pixels) in conjunction with the window's font size.
member.param: The number of form units.
If the form units are on the X axis, set this parameter to false. If the form units are on the Y axis, set this parameter to true.
member.returns: the number of pixels if the function succeeds. Returns zero (0) if the window that called this function is invalid.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalDataField.GetFirstChild(PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber)
member.summary: Returns the handle of the first child window of the specified type. You can use this function to get the handles of MDI child windows.

remarks.para: Window types:

and are statistics by default and not implemented as windows. If you want this function to work for lines and frames set the system variable bStaticsAsWindows to TRUE. This is a global system variable, so the setting persists until it is changed.

member.param: One or more window types combined (using the OR (|) operator) to create a mask of child window types.
member.returns: the first child window of the specified type. Returns if there is no child window or if the window that called this function is invalid.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalDataField.GetNextChild(PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber)
member.summary: Returns the handle of the next child window that matches a specified type.

remarks.para: Window types:

Use this function after calling to get the other child window siblings. You can use this function to get the handles of MDI child windows. If you want this function to work for lines and frames, set the system variable bStaticsAsWindows to true. This is a global system variable, so the setting persists until you change it.

member.param: One or more window types combined (using the OR (|) operator) to create a mask of child window types.
member.returns: the next child window of the specified type. Returns if there is no child window or if the window that called this function is invalid.

member.summary: Sets the text of a window.
member.remarks: A window's text is the title of a form window, modeless dialog box, table window, radio button, check box, or push button. For a data field or table window column, the text is the object's value in string form, regardless of the object's data type. For a combo box, the text is the contents of the editable data field portion.If the combo box is not editable, it tries to set the list selection to the item that matches the specified string. This latter statement is true for list boxes as well.
member.param: The window text.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if it fails.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalDataField.ShowWindow
member.summary: Makes a window visible.
member.returns: true if the previous state of the window was visible and false if it was hidden. Use this information to hide many windows without first checking that they are visible. When you restore them to their original state at a later point in time, the return lets you make visible only those windows that were previously visible.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalDataField.KillTimer(PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber)
member.summary: Destroys an object's system timer. Removes any pending messages from the message queue of the object.
member.remarks: Set a system timer with the function. Note: Timers are a limited global resource. Your application must check the value returned by to verify that the timer was created.
member.param: The timer ID to kill.
member.returns: true if the event is successfully killed and false if the specified timer cannot be found.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalDataField.SetTimer(PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber,PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber)
member.summary: Creates a system timer for a given object. When a timer event occurs, sends messages to the object in specified intervals. Timers are a limited global resource. Your application must check the value returned by SetTimer() to verify that the timer was created.
member.param: The timer ID number.
The elapsed time between each message, in milliseconds.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if it fails.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalDataField.TrackPopupMenu(PPJ.Runtime.SalString,PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber,PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber,PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber)
member.summary: Creates pop-up menus at runtime.
member.remarks: Possible flag values:
member.param: The name of a pop-up menu accessible to the window that called this function. For example, a menu defined by the window that called this function or its MDI window parent, or a global menu.
Specifies how the pop-up menu displays. You can combine flag values using the OR (|) operator.
The position of the pop-up menu on the X axis. The value of this parameter is ignored if you set the flag in flags.

The position of the pop-up menu on the Y axis. The value of this parameter is ignored if you set the in flags. The x and y Parameters together represent a point (the top left, top middle, or top right) of the pop-up menu, depending on the flags value.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if it fails.

The position of the pop-up menu on the X axis. The value of this parameter is ignored if you set the flag in flags.

The position of the pop-up menu on the Y axis. The value of this parameter is ignored if you set the in flags. The x and y Parameters together represent a point (the top left, top middle, or top right) of the pop-up menu, depending on the flags value.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if it fails.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalDataField.IsDerivedFromClass(System.Type)
member.summary: Determines whether a window is an instance of the specified class.
member.remarks: Tells you if a window is an instance of the class that you specify or an instance of a class that is derived from the class that you specify. Call this function to determine if you can make a late-bound call to a function defined in the named class using the window handle that you specify. If you make a late-bound function call with a handle that is not for a window derived from the named class and the function returns a value, you get an error at runtime and the application ends.
member.param: The class type. Not a string. Type the class name without single quotes.
member.returns: true if the window is an instance of the named class or an instance of a class that is derived from the named class.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalDataField.SetModified(PPJ.Runtime.SalBoolean)
member.summary: Sets or clears the field edit flag for an editable data field, combo box, multi line text field, table window column, or picture.
member.remarks: The Field Edit Flag is set whenever the user changes the value of a data field, multiline field, combo box or table window column. For a picture, the field edit flag is set whenever a server application is opened for editing. The field edit flag is not set if you make the change with a Set statement or a fetch from a database.
member.param: true sets the flag; false clears it.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if it fails.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalDataField.IsModified
member.summary: Returns the setting of the Field Edit Flag for a data field, multi line field, combo box, table window's context row cell, or picture.

remarks.para: The field edit flag is set whenever the user changes the value of an editable data field, multiline text field, or table window column. For a picture, the field edit flag is set whenever a server application is opened for editing. The field edit flag is not set if you make the change with a Set statement or a fetch from the database.
This function does NOT clear the field edit flag of the window.

member.returns: true if the field edit flag is set and false otherwise.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalDataField.GetLabel
member.summary: Retrieves the window handle of the label (label control) that is associated with the hWndTarget parameter. There must be a mnemonic in that label, and it must immediately precede hWndTarget in the outline, or this function will fail.
member.returns: The Label Control associated with the window that called this function.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalDataField.DisableWindowAndLabel
member.summary: Disables keyboard and mouse input to a window and grays out its associated label. A label is the label control that immediately precedes the window in the outline. The label control must have a mnemonic. If the window contains text (for example, a push button), the text is grayed. If the window is a data field, it cannot receive the focus.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if it fails.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalDataField.EnableWindowAndLabel
member.summary: Enables keyboard and mouse input to a window and enables its associated label as well. A label is the label control that immediately precedes the window in the outline.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if it fails.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalDataField.ShowWindowAndLabel
member.summary: Makes a window and its associated label visible. A label is the label control that immediately precedes the window in the outline.
member.returns: true if the previous state of the window was visible and false if it was hidden. Use this information to hide many windows without first checking that they are visible. When you restore them to their original state at a later point in time, the return lets you make visible only those windows that were previously visible.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalDataField.HideWindowAndLabel
member.summary: Hides a window and its associated label.
member.remarks: A label is the background text that immediately precedes the window in the outline. This function does not destroy the window; it only makes the window invisible.
member.returns: true if the previous state of the window was visible and false if it was hidden. Use this information to hide many windows without first checking that they are visible. When you restore them to their original state at a later point in time, the return lets you make visible only those windows that were previously visible.

member.remarks: Strips off formatting characters and validates a field's contents according to type. After that, validates picture formatting characters that you enter to ensure that they conform to the profile requirements. For dates, you must enter the proper separator characters in order for the field to be validated successfully.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false otherwise, such as when the input is invalid. If it returns false, optionally displays an error dialog box.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalFrame.SetContextMenu(PPJ.Runtime.SalString,PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber)
member.summary: Defines a named popup menu that displays automatically when a window receives SAM_ContextMenu.
member.remarks: For some windows, this function also affects how the window processes a right mouse button click: List box-Right click selects the line under the cursor.If the line is already selected, there is no effect. Combo box-For a combo box where the list is always displayed, the behavior is the same as for a list box. Table window-Right click selects the row under the cursor. If the row is already selected there is no effect.
member.param: A named menu defined in one of the Named Menus section in the control, its MDI window parent, or Global Declarations.
Set this to to replace the default menu that Windows displays when the mouse pointer is in an editable table window cell. Otherwise, set this to zero.
member.returns: true if this function succeeds and false otherwise.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalFrame.SetContextMenu(System.Type,PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber)

member.returns: true if this function succeeds and false otherwise.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalFrame.FormUnitsToPixels(PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber,PPJ.Runtime.SalBoolean)
member.summary: Computes the number of pixels in the number of form units. Form units are a unit of measurement used by functions which move and position objects. Form units are computed using physical units (pixels) in conjunction with the window's font size.
member.param: The number of form units.
If the form units are on the X axis, set this parameter to false. If the form units are on the Y axis, set this parameter to true.
member.returns: the number of pixels if the function succeeds. Returns zero (0) if the control is invalid.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalFrame.GetFirstChild(PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber)
member.summary: Returns the handle of the first child window of the specified type. You can use this function to get the handles of MDI child windows.

remarks.para: Window types:

and are statistics by default and not implemented as windows. If you want this function to work for lines and frames set the system variable bStaticsAsWindows to TRUE. This is a global system variable, so the setting persists until it is changed.

member.param: One or more window types combined (using the OR (|) operator) to create a mask of child window types.
member.returns: the first child window of the specified type. Returns if there is no child window or if the control is invalid.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalFrame.GetNextChild(PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber)
member.summary: Returns the handle of the next child window that matches a specified type.

remarks.para: Window types:

Use this function after calling GetFirstChild() to get the other child window siblings. You can use this function to get the handles of MDI child windows. If you want this function to work for lines and frames, set the system variable bStaticsAsWindows to true. This is a global system variable, so the setting persists until you change it.

member.param: One or more window types combined (using the OR (|) operator) to create a mask of child window types.
member.returns: the next child window of the specified type. Returns if there is no child window or if the window is invalid.

For a data field or table window column, the text is the object's value in string form, regardless of the object's data type. For a combo box, the text is the contents of the editable data field portion.If the combo box is not editable, it tries to set the list selection to the item that matches the specified string. member.remarks: Possible flag values:
member.param: The name of a pop-up menu accessible to the owner. For example, a menu defined by the owner or its MDI window parent, or a global menu.
Specifies how the pop-up menu displays. You can combine flag values using the OR (|) operator.
The position of the pop-up menu on the X axis. The value of this parameter is ignored if you set the flag in flags.

The position of the pop-up menu on the Y axis. The value of this parameter is ignored if you set the in flags. The x and y Parameters together represent a point (the top left, top middle, or top right) of the pop-up menu, depending on the flags value.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalFrame.UpdateWindow

member.remarks: Painting is a low priority. Paint messages are sent to the end of an object's message queue and are processed after all other messages in the queue. If, during the development phase of your application, you find that painting is being delayed, you can force a window to update.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalFrame.IsDerivedFromClass(System.Type)
member.summary: Determines whether a window is an instance of the specified class.
member.remarks: Tells you if a window is an instance of the class that you specify or an instance of a class that is derived from the class that you specify. Call this function to determine if you can make a late-bound call to a function defined in the named class using the window handle that you specify. If you make a late-bound function call with a handle that is not for a window derived from the named class and the function returns a value, you get an error at runtime and the application ends.
member.param: The class type. Not a string. Type the class name without single quotes.
member.returns: true if the window is an instance of the named class or an instance of a class that is derived from the named class.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalGroupBox.SetContextMenu(PPJ.Runtime.SalString,PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber)
member.summary: Defines a named popup menu that displays automatically when a window receives SAM_ContextMenu.
member.remarks: For some windows, this function also affects how the window processes a right mouse button click: List box-Right click selects the line under the cursor.If the line is already selected, there is no effect. Combo box-For a combo box where the list is always displayed, the behavior is the same as for a list box. Table window-Right click selects the row under the cursor. If the row is already selected there is no effect.
member.param: A named menu defined in one of the Named Menus section in the control, its MDI window parent, or Global Declarations.
Set this to to replace the default menu that Windows displays when the mouse pointer is in an editable table window cell. Otherwise, set this to zero.
member.returns: true if this function succeeds and false otherwise.

member.summary: Returns the handle of the first child window of the specified type. You can use this function to get the handles of MDI child windows.

remarks.para: Window types:

and are statistics by default and not implemented as windows. If you want this function to work for lines and frames set the system variable bStaticsAsWindows to TRUE. This is a global system variable, so the setting persists until it is changed.

member.param: One or more window types combined (using the OR (|) operator) to create a mask of child window types.
member.returns: the first child window of the specified type. Returns if there is no child window or if the control is invalid.

If you want this function to work for lines and frames, set the system variable bStaticsAsWindows to true. This is a global system variable, so the setting persists until you change it.

member.summary: Sets the text of a window.
member.remarks: A window's text is the title of a form window, modeless dialog box, table window, radio button, check box, or push button. For a data field or table window column, the text is the object's value in string form, regardless of the object's data type. For a combo box, the text is the contents of the editable data field portion.If the combo box is not editable, it tries to set the list selection to the item that matches the specified string. This latter statement is true for list boxes as well.
member.param: The window text.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if it fails.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalGroupBox.ShowWindow
member.summary: Makes a window visible.
member.returns: true if the previous state of the window was visible and false if it was hidden. Use this information to hide many windows without first checking that they are visible. When you restore them to their original state at a later point in time, the return lets you make visible only those windows that were previously visible.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalGroupBox.IsDerivedFromClass(System.Type)
member.summary: Determines whether a window is an instance of the specified class.
member.remarks: Tells you if a window is an instance of the class that you specify or an instance of a class that is derived from the class that you specify. Call this function to determine if you can make a late-bound call to a function defined in the named class using the window handle that you specify. If you make a late-bound function call with a handle that is not for a window derived from the named class and the function returns a value, you get an error at runtime and the application ends.
member.param: The class type. Not a string. Type the class name without single quotes.
member.returns: true if the window is an instance of the named class or an instance of a class that is derived from the named class.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalHorizontalScrollBar.SetContextMenu(PPJ.Runtime.SalString,PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber)
member.summary: Defines a named popup menu that displays automatically when a window receives SAM_ContextMenu.
member.remarks: For some windows, this function also affects how the window processes a right mouse button click: List box-Right click selects the line under the cursor.If the line is already selected, there is no effect. Combo box-For a combo box where the list is always displayed, the behavior is the same as for a list box. Table window-Right click selects the row under the cursor. If the row is already selected there is no effect.
member.param: A named menu defined in one of the Named Menus section in the control, its MDI window parent, or Global Declarations.
Set this to to replace the default menu that Windows displays when the mouse pointer is in an editable table window cell. Otherwise, set this to zero.
member.returns: true if this function succeeds and false otherwise.

member.summary: Returns the handle of the first child window of the specified type. You can use this function to get the handles of MDI child windows.

remarks.para: Window types:

and are statistics by default and not implemented as windows. If you want this function to work for lines and frames set the system variable bStaticsAsWindows to TRUE. This is a global system variable, so the setting persists until it is changed.

member.param: One or more window types combined (using the OR (|) operator) to create a mask of child window types.

member.summary: Returns the handle of the next child window that matches a specified type.

remarks.para: Window types:

Use this function after calling GetFirstChild() to get the other child window siblings. You can use this function to get the handles of MDI child windows. If you want this function to work for lines and frames, set the system variable bStaticsAsWindows to true. This is a global system variable, so the setting persists until you change it.

member.param: One or more window types combined (using the OR (|) operator) to create a mask of child window types.

member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if it fails.

member.remarks: Possible flag values:
member.param: The type of a pop-up menu accessible to the owner.
Specifies how the pop-up menu displays. You can combine flag values using the OR (|) operator.
The position of the pop-up menu on the X axis. The value of this parameter is ignored if you set the flag in flags.

The position of the pop-up menu on the Y axis. The value of this parameter is ignored if you set the in flags. The x and y Parameters together represent a point (the top left, top middle, or top right) of the pop-up menu, depending on the flags value.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if it fails.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalHorizontalScrollBar.UpdateWindow
member.summary: Forces the update of a window.
member.remarks: Painting is a low priority. Paint messages are sent to the end of an object's message queue and are processed after all other messages in the queue. If, during the development phase of your application, you find that painting is being delayed, you can force a window to update.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if the window is not valid.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalHorizontalScrollBar.IsDerivedFromClass(System.Type)
member.summary: Determines whether a window is an instance of the specified class.
member.remarks: Tells you if a window is an instance of the class that you specify or an instance of a class that is derived from the class that you specify. Call this function to determine if you can make a late-bound call to a function defined in the named class using the window handle that you specify. If you make a late-bound function call with a handle that is not for a window derived from the named class and the function returns a value, you get an error at runtime and the application ends.
member.param: The class type. Not a string. Type the class name without single quotes.
member.returns: true if the window is an instance of the named class or an instance of a class that is derived from the named class.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalHorizontalScrollBar.SetModified(PPJ.Runtime.SalBoolean)
member.summary: Sets or clears the field edit flag for an editable data field, combo box, multi line text field, table window column, or picture.
member.remarks: The Field Edit Flag is set whenever the user changes the value of a data field, multiline field, combo box or table window column. For a picture, the field edit flag is set whenever a server application is opened for editing. The field edit flag is not set if you make the change with a Set statement or a fetch from a database.
member.param: true sets the flag; false clears it.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if it fails.

For a picture, the field edit flag is set whenever a server application is opened for editing. The field edit flag is not set if you make the change with a Set statement or a fetch from the database.
member.returns: true if the field edit flag is set and false otherwise.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalHorizontalScrollBar.GetLabel
member.summary: Retrieves the window handle of the label (label control) that is associated with the object that called this function. There must be a mnemonic in that label, and it must immediately precede hWndTarget in the outline, or this function will fail.
member.returns: The Label Control associated with the object that called this function.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalHorizontalScrollBar.DisableWindowAndLabel
member.summary: Disables keyboard and mouse input to a window and grays out its associated label. A label is the label control that immediately precedes the window in the outline. The label control must have a mnemonic. If the window contains text (for example, a push button), the text is grayed. If the window is a data field, it cannot receive the focus.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if it fails.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalHorizontalScrollBar.EnableWindowAndLabel
member.summary: Enables keyboard and mouse input to a window and enables its associated label as well. A label is the label control that immediately precedes the window in the outline.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if it fails.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalHorizontalScrollBar.ShowWindowAndLabel
member.summary: Makes a window and its associated label visible. A label is the label control that immediately precedes the window in the outline.
member.returns: true if the previous state of the window was visible and false if it was hidden. Use this information to hide many windows without first checking that they are visible. When you restore them to their original state at a later point in time, the return lets you make visible only those windows that were previously visible.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalHorizontalScrollBar.HideWindowAndLabel
member.summary: Hides a window and its associated label.
member.remarks: A label is the background text that immediately precedes the window in the outline. This function does not destroy the window; it only makes the window invisible.
member.returns: true if the previous state of the window was visible and false if it was hidden. Use this information to hide many windows without first checking that they are visible. When you restore them to their original state at a later point in time, the return lets you make visible only those windows that were previously visible.

member.summary: Gets a scroll bar's scroll range, line increment, and page increment.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalHorizontalScrollBar.SetScrollBarPosition(PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber)
member.summary: Sets the scrollbar's value.
member.remarks: This function is equivalent to using a Set statement to assign a value to the scroll bar.
member.param: The scroll bar position. If this value is outside the scroll bar's range, sets the scroll bar position to the scroll range minimum or the scroll range maximum, depending on whether is below or above the range.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if it fails.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalHorizontalScrollBar.SetScrollBarRange(PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber,PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber,PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber,PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber)
member.summary: Sets a scroll bar's range, line increment, and page increment.

remarks.para: When the scroll bar is created, it is assigned these values:
Minimum scroll position: 0
Maximum scroll position: 100
Line Increment: 1
Page Increment: 10

If the scroll bar's position before calling this function is outside the range specified by and , its position changes to fall within the new range. and must lie within the range of -32,767 to 32,767.

member.param: The minimum position of the scroll bar.
The maximum position of the scroll bar.
The number of units to increment or decrement the scroll bar when the user clicks the scroll bar arrow.
The number of units to increment or decrement the scroll bar when the user clicks either side of the scroll box.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if it fails.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalLine.SetContextMenu(PPJ.Runtime.SalString,PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber)
member.summary: Defines a named popup menu that displays automatically when a window receives SAM_ContextMenu.
member.remarks: For some windows, this function also affects how the window processes a right mouse button click: List box-Right click selects the line under the cursor.If the line is already selected, there is no effect. Combo box-For a combo box where the list is always displayed, the behavior is the same as for a list box. Table window-Right click selects the row under the cursor. If the row is already selected there is no effect.
member.param: A named menu defined in one of the Named Menus section in the control, its MDI window parent, or Global Declarations.
Set this to to replace the default menu that Windows displays when the mouse pointer is in an editable table window cell. Otherwise, set this to zero.
member.returns: true if this function succeeds and false otherwise.

member.summary: Returns the handle of the first child window of the specified type. You can use this function to get the handles of MDI child windows.

remarks.para: Window types:

and are statistics by default and not implemented as windows. If you want this function to work for lines and frames set the system variable bStaticsAsWindows to TRUE. This is a global system variable, so the setting persists until it is changed.

member.param: One or more window types combined (using the OR (|) operator) to create a mask of child window types.
member.returns: the first child window of the specified type. Returns if there is no child window or if the control is invalid.

member.summary: Sets the text of a window.
member.remarks: A window's text is the title of a form window, modeless dialog box, table window, radio button, check box, or push button. For a data field or table window column, the text is the object's value in string form, regardless of the object's data type. For a combo box, the text is the contents of the editable data field portion.If the combo box is not editable, it tries to set the list selection to the item that matches the specified string. This latter statement is true for list boxes as well.
member.param: The window text.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if it fails.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalLine.ShowWindow
member.summary: Makes a window visible.
member.returns: true if the previous state of the window was visible and false if it was hidden. Use this information to hide many windows without first checking that they are visible. When you restore them to their original state at a later point in time, the return lets you make visible only those windows that were previously visible.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalLine.SetTimer(PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber,PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber)

The elapsed time between each message, in milliseconds.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if it fails.
