member.summary: Creates pop-up menus at runtime.
member.remarks: Possible flag values:
member.param: The name of a pop-up menu accessible to the owner. For example, a menu defined by the owner or its MDI window parent, or a global menu.
Specifies how the pop-up menu displays. You can combine flag values using the OR (|) operator.
The position of the pop-up menu on the X axis. The value of this parameter is ignored if you set the flag in flags.

The position of the pop-up menu on the Y axis. The value of this parameter is ignored if you set the in flags. The x and y Parameters together represent a point (the top left, top middle, or top right) of the pop-up menu, depending on the flags value.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalLine.IsDerivedFromClass(System.Type)
member.summary: Determines whether a window is an instance of the specified class.
member.remarks: Tells you if a window is an instance of the class that you specify or an instance of a class that is derived from the class that you specify. Call this function to determine if you can make a late-bound call to a function defined in the named class using the window handle that you specify. If you make a late-bound function call with a handle that is not for a window derived from the named class and the function returns a value, you get an error at runtime and the application ends.
member.param: The class type. Not a string. Type the class name without single quotes.
member.returns: true if the window is an instance of the named class or an instance of a class that is derived from the named class.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalListBox.SetContextMenu(PPJ.Runtime.SalString,PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber)
member.summary: Defines a named popup menu that displays automatically when a window receives SAM_ContextMenu.
member.remarks: For some windows, this function also affects how the window processes a right mouse button click: List box-Right click selects the line under the cursor.If the line is already selected, there is no effect. Combo box-For a combo box where the list is always displayed, the behavior is the same as for a list box. Table window-Right click selects the row under the cursor. If the row is already selected there is no effect.
member.param: A named menu defined in one of the Named Menus section in the control, its MDI window parent, or Global Declarations.
Set this to to replace the default menu that Windows displays when the mouse pointer is in an editable table window cell. Otherwise, set this to zero.
member.returns: true if this function succeeds and false otherwise.

member.summary: Returns the handle of the first child window of the specified type. You can use this function to get the handles of MDI child windows.

remarks.para: Window types:

and are statistics by default and not implemented as windows. If you want this function to work for lines and frames set the system variable bStaticsAsWindows to TRUE. This is a global system variable, so the setting persists until it is changed.

member.param: One or more window types combined (using the OR (|) operator) to create a mask of child window types.
member.returns: the first child window of the specified type. Returns if there is no child window or if the control is invalid.

Use this function after calling GetFirstChild() to get the other child window siblings. You can use this function to get the handles of MDI child windows. If you want this function to work for lines and frames, set the system variable bStaticsAsWindows to true. This is a global system variable, so the setting persists until you change it.

member.param: One or more window types combined (using the OR (|) operator) to create a mask of child window types.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalListBox.UpdateWindow
member.summary: Forces the update of a window.
member.remarks: Painting is a low priority. Paint messages are sent to the end of an object's message queue and are processed after all other messages in the queue. If, during the development phase of your application, you find that painting is being delayed, you can force a window to update.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if the window is not valid.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalListBox.IsDerivedFromClass(System.Type)
member.summary: Determines whether a window is an instance of the specified class.
member.remarks: Tells you if a window is an instance of the class that you specify or an instance of a class that is derived from the class that you specify. Call this function to determine if you can make a late-bound call to a function defined in the named class using the window handle that you specify. If you make a late-bound function call with a handle that is not for a window derived from the named class and the function returns a value, you get an error at runtime and the application ends.
member.param: The class type. Not a string. Type the class name without single quotes.
member.returns: true if the window is an instance of the named class or an instance of a class that is derived from the named class.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalListBox.SetModified(PPJ.Runtime.SalBoolean)
member.summary: Sets or clears the field edit flag for an editable data field, combo box, multi line text field, table window column, or picture.
member.remarks: The Field Edit Flag is set whenever the user changes the value of a data field, multiline field, combo box or table window column. For a picture, the field edit flag is set whenever a server application is opened for editing. The field edit flag is not set if you make the change with a Set statement or a fetch from a database.
member.param: true sets the flag; false clears it.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if it fails.

For a picture, the field edit flag is set whenever a server application is opened for editing. The field edit flag is not set if you make the change with a Set statement or a fetch from the database.
member.returns: true if the field edit flag is set and false otherwise.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalListBox.GetLabel
member.summary: Retrieves the window handle of the label (label control) that is associated with the object that called this function. There must be a mnemonic in that label, and it must immediately precede hWndTarget in the outline, or this function will fail.
member.returns: The Label Control associated with the object that called this function.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalListBox.DisableWindowAndLabel
member.summary: Disables keyboard and mouse input to a window and grays out its associated label. A label is the label control that immediately precedes the window in the outline. The label control must have a mnemonic. If the window contains text (for example, a push button), the text is grayed. If the window is a data field, it cannot receive the focus.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if it fails.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalListBox.EnableWindowAndLabel
member.summary: Enables keyboard and mouse input to a window and enables its associated label as well. A label is the label control that immediately precedes the window in the outline.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if it fails.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalListBox.ShowWindowAndLabel
member.summary: Makes a window and its associated label visible. A label is the label control that immediately precedes the window in the outline.
member.returns: true if the previous state of the window was visible and false if it was hidden. Use this information to hide many windows without first checking that they are visible. When you restore them to their original state at a later point in time, the return lets you make visible only those windows that were previously visible.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalListBox.HideWindowAndLabel
member.summary: Hides a window and its associated label.
member.remarks: A label is the background text that immediately precedes the window in the outline. This function does not destroy the window; it only makes the window invisible.
member.returns: true if the previous state of the window was visible and false if it was hidden. Use this information to hide many windows without first checking that they are visible. When you restore them to their original state at a later point in time, the return lets you make visible only those windows that were previously visible.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalListBox.PopulateList(PPJ.Runtime.Sql.SalSqlHandle,PPJ.Runtime.SalString)
member.summary: Populates a list box or combo box with a result set. PopulateList() overrides any settings made with ListSetTabs(). If the SELECT statement returns data from multiple columns, each column's data displayed in a list box is separated by tabs. However, due to a Microsoft Windows limitation, each column's data displayed in a combo box is separated by a single '|' character. There is no space between one column's data, the separator character, and another column's data.
member.remarks: The SELECT statement can contain bind variables, but it cannot contain INTO variables. If is null (''), uses the previously prepared SELECT statement associated with This avoids re-preparing each time PopulateList() executes.
member.param: A to execute the command.
SQL command to execute.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if any of the parameters are invalid or if contains INTO variables.

member.param: A to execute the command.

member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if any of the parameters are invalid or if contains INTO variables.

member.name: T:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.Spell.SpellChecker
member.summary: Spell checker and highlighter engine.

remarks.para: Uses the hunspell DLLs to load standard hunspell dictionaries and draws the underline marker in any control derived from TextBoxBase, ComboBox, or ISalEditControl.
This class is capable of spelling and highlighting errors is TextBox, ComboBox, RichEdit, SalDataField, SalMultilineField, and SalTableColum (when in edit mode).

Dictionaries are usually loaded from two files: .aff and .dic files. The dictionary files must be present in the same directory of the application being executed. In alternative, dictionaries can also be loaded from embedded resources or any other storage type using SpellChecker.LoadDictionary() methods.

To download additional dictionaries go here: http://extensions.services.openoffice.org/en/dictionaries Download the file for the language you need, change the extension from OXT to ZIP, from the zip archive extract the two .aff and .dic files. Make sure that the name follows the standard [lang]-[COUNTRY].

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalMultilineField.SetContextMenu(PPJ.Runtime.SalString,PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber)
member.summary: Defines a named popup menu that displays automatically when a window receives SAM_ContextMenu.
member.remarks: For some windows, this function also affects how the window processes a right mouse button click: List box-Right click selects the line under the cursor.If the line is already selected, there is no effect. Combo box-For a combo box where the list is always displayed, the behavior is the same as for a list box. Table window-Right click selects the row under the cursor. If the row is already selected there is no effect.
member.param: A named menu defined in one of the Named Menus section in the control, its MDI window parent, or Global Declarations.
Set this to to replace the default menu that Windows displays when the mouse pointer is in an editable table window cell. Otherwise, set this to zero.
member.returns: true if this function succeeds and false otherwise.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalMultilineField.FormUnitsToPixels(PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber,PPJ.Runtime.SalBoolean)
member.summary: Computes the number of pixels in the number of form units. Form units are a unit of measurement used by functions which move and position objects. Form units are computed using physical units (pixels) in conjunction with the window's font size.
member.param: The number of form units.
If the form units are on the X axis, set this parameter to false. If the form units are on the Y axis, set this parameter to true.
member.returns: the number of pixels if the function succeeds. Returns zero (0) if the control is invalid.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalMultilineField.GetFirstChild(PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber)
member.summary: Returns the handle of the first child window of the specified type. You can use this function to get the handles of MDI child windows.

remarks.para: Window types:

and are statistics by default and not implemented as windows. If you want this function to work for lines and frames set the system variable bStaticsAsWindows to TRUE. This is a global system variable, so the setting persists until it is changed.

member.param: One or more window types combined (using the OR (|) operator) to create a mask of child window types.
member.returns: the first child window of the specified type. Returns if there is no child window or if the control is invalid.

member.summary: Returns the handle of the next child window that matches a specified type.

remarks.para: Window types:

Use this function after calling GetFirstChild() to get the other child window siblings. You can use this function to get the handles of MDI child windows. If you want this function to work for lines and frames, set the system variable bStaticsAsWindows to true. This is a global system variable, so the setting persists until you change it.

member.param: One or more window types combined (using the OR (|) operator) to create a mask of child window types.
member.returns: the next child window of the specified type. Returns if there is no child window or if the window is invalid.

member.summary: Sets the text of a window.
member.remarks: A window's text is the title of a form window, modeless dialog box, table window, radio button, check box, or push button. For a data field or table window column, the text is the object's value in string form, regardless of the object's data type. For a combo box, the text is the contents of the editable data field portion.If the combo box is not editable, it tries to set the list selection to the item that matches the specified string. This latter statement is true for list boxes as well.
member.param: The window text.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if it fails.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalMultilineField.ShowWindow

member.returns: true if the previous state of the window was visible and false if it was hidden. Use this information to hide many windows without first checking that they are visible. When you restore them to their original state at a later point in time, the return lets you make visible only those windows that were previously visible.

The position of the pop-up menu on the X axis. The value of this parameter is ignored if you set the flag in flags.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalMultilineField.IsDerivedFromClass(System.Type)
member.summary: Determines whether a window is an instance of the specified class.
member.remarks: Tells you if a window is an instance of the class that you specify or an instance of a class that is derived from the class that you specify. Call this function to determine if you can make a late-bound call to a function defined in the named class using the window handle that you specify. If you make a late-bound function call with a handle that is not for a window derived from the named class and the function returns a value, you get an error at runtime and the application ends.
member.param: The class type. Not a string. Type the class name without single quotes.
member.returns: true if the window is an instance of the named class or an instance of a class that is derived from the named class.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalMultilineField.SetModified(PPJ.Runtime.SalBoolean)
member.summary: Sets or clears the field edit flag for an editable data field, combo box, multi line text field, table window column, or picture.
member.remarks: The Field Edit Flag is set whenever the user changes the value of a data field, multiline field, combo box or table window column. For a picture, the field edit flag is set whenever a server application is opened for editing. The field edit flag is not set if you make the change with a Set statement or a fetch from a database.
member.param: true sets the flag; false clears it.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if it fails.

For a picture, the field edit flag is set whenever a server application is opened for editing. The field edit flag is not set if you make the change with a Set statement or a fetch from the database.
member.returns: true if the field edit flag is set and false otherwise.

member.summary: Retrieves the window handle of the label (label control) that is associated with the object that called this function. There must be a mnemonic in that label, and it must immediately precede hWndTarget in the outline, or this function will fail.
member.returns: The Label Control associated with the object that called this function.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalMultilineField.DisableWindowAndLabel
member.summary: Disables keyboard and mouse input to a window and grays out its associated label. A label is the label control that immediately precedes the window in the outline. The label control must have a mnemonic. If the window contains text (for example, a push button), the text is grayed. If the window is a data field, it cannot receive the focus.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if it fails.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalMultilineField.EnableWindowAndLabel
member.summary: Enables keyboard and mouse input to a window and enables its associated label as well. A label is the label control that immediately precedes the window in the outline.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if it fails.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalMultilineField.ShowWindowAndLabel
member.summary: Makes a window and its associated label visible. A label is the label control that immediately precedes the window in the outline.
member.returns: true if the previous state of the window was visible and false if it was hidden. Use this information to hide many windows without first checking that they are visible. When you restore them to their original state at a later point in time, the return lets you make visible only those windows that were previously visible.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalMultilineField.HideWindowAndLabel
member.summary: Hides a window and its associated label.
member.remarks: A label is the background text that immediately precedes the window in the outline. This function does not destroy the window; it only makes the window invisible.
member.returns: true if the previous state of the window was visible and false if it was hidden. Use this information to hide many windows without first checking that they are visible. When you restore them to their original state at a later point in time, the return lets you make visible only those windows that were previously visible.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalOptionButton.SetContextMenu(PPJ.Runtime.SalString,PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber)
member.summary: Defines a named popup menu that displays automatically when a window receives SAM_ContextMenu.
member.remarks: For some windows, this function also affects how the window processes a right mouse button click: List box-Right click selects the line under the cursor.If the line is already selected, there is no effect. Combo box-For a combo box where the list is always displayed, the behavior is the same as for a list box. Table window-Right click selects the row under the cursor. If the row is already selected there is no effect.
member.param: A named menu defined in one of the Named Menus section in the control, its MDI window parent, or Global Declarations.
Set this to to replace the default menu that Windows displays when the mouse pointer is in an editable table window cell. Otherwise, set this to zero.
member.returns: true if this function succeeds and false otherwise.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalOptionButton.SetContextMenu(System.Type,PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber)

member.returns: true if this function succeeds and false otherwise.

member.param: The number of form units.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalOptionButton.GetFirstChild(PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber)
member.summary: Returns the handle of the first child window of the specified type. You can use this function to get the handles of MDI child windows.

remarks.para: Window types:

and are statistics by default and not implemented as windows. If you want this function to work for lines and frames set the system variable bStaticsAsWindows to TRUE. This is a global system variable, so the setting persists until it is changed.

member.param: One or more window types combined (using the OR (|) operator) to create a mask of child window types.
member.returns: the first child window of the specified type. Returns if there is no child window or if the control is invalid.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalOptionButton.GetNextChild(PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber)
member.summary: Returns the handle of the next child window that matches a specified type.

remarks.para: Window types:

Use this function after calling GetFirstChild() to get the other child window siblings. You can use this function to get the handles of MDI child windows. If you want this function to work for lines and frames, set the system variable bStaticsAsWindows to true. This is a global system variable, so the setting persists until you change it.

member.param: One or more window types combined (using the OR (|) operator) to create a mask of child window types.
member.returns: the next child window of the specified type. Returns if there is no child window or if the window is invalid.

member.summary: Sets the text of a window.
member.remarks: A window's text is the title of a form window, modeless dialog box, table window, radio button, check box, or push button. For a data field or table window column, the text is the object's value in string form, regardless of the object's data type. For a combo box, the text is the contents of the editable data field portion.If the combo box is not editable, it tries to set the list selection to the item that matches the specified string. This latter statement is true for list boxes as well.
member.param: The window text.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if it fails.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalOptionButton.ShowWindow
member.summary: Makes a window visible.
member.returns: true if the previous state of the window was visible and false if it was hidden. Use this information to hide many windows without first checking that they are visible. When you restore them to their original state at a later point in time, the return lets you make visible only those windows that were previously visible.

The elapsed time between each message, in milliseconds.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if it fails.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalOptionButton.TrackPopupMenu(PPJ.Runtime.SalString,PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber,PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber,PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber)
member.summary: Creates pop-up menus at runtime.
member.remarks: Possible flag values:
member.param: The name of a pop-up menu accessible to the owner. For example, a menu defined by the owner or its MDI window parent, or a global menu.
Specifies how the pop-up menu displays. You can combine flag values using the OR (|) operator.
The position of the pop-up menu on the X axis. The value of this parameter is ignored if you set the flag in flags.

The position of the pop-up menu on the Y axis. The value of this parameter is ignored if you set the in flags. The x and y Parameters together represent a point (the top left, top middle, or top right) of the pop-up menu, depending on the flags value.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if it fails.

The position of the pop-up menu on the Y axis. The value of this parameter is ignored if you set the in flags. The x and y Parameters together represent a point (the top left, top middle, or top right) of the pop-up menu, depending on the flags value.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalOptionButton.UpdateWindow

member.remarks: Painting is a low priority. Paint messages are sent to the end of an object's message queue and are processed after all other messages in the queue. If, during the development phase of your application, you find that painting is being delayed, you can force a window to update.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if the window is not valid.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalOptionButton.IsDerivedFromClass(System.Type)
member.summary: Determines whether a window is an instance of the specified class.
member.remarks: Tells you if a window is an instance of the class that you specify or an instance of a class that is derived from the class that you specify. Call this function to determine if you can make a late-bound call to a function defined in the named class using the window handle that you specify. If you make a late-bound function call with a handle that is not for a window derived from the named class and the function returns a value, you get an error at runtime and the application ends.
member.param: The class type. Not a string. Type the class name without single quotes.
member.returns: true if the window is an instance of the named class or an instance of a class that is derived from the named class.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalOptionButton.SetModified(PPJ.Runtime.SalBoolean)
member.summary: Sets or clears the field edit flag for an editable data field, combo box, multi line text field, table window column, or picture.
member.remarks: The Field Edit Flag is set whenever the user changes the value of a data field, multiline field, combo box or table window column. For a picture, the field edit flag is set whenever a server application is opened for editing. The field edit flag is not set if you make the change with a Set statement or a fetch from a database.
member.param: true sets the flag; false clears it.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if it fails.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalOptionButton.IsModified
member.summary: Returns the setting of the Field Edit Flag for a data field, multi line field, combo box, table window's context row cell, or picture.
member.remarks: The field edit flag is set whenever the user changes the value of an editable data field, multiline text field, or table window column. For a picture, the field edit flag is set whenever a server application is opened for editing. The field edit flag is not set if you make the change with a Set statement or a fetch from the database.
member.returns: true if the field edit flag is set and false otherwise.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalOptionButton.GetLabel
member.summary: Retrieves the window handle of the label (label control) that is associated with the object that called this function. There must be a mnemonic in that label, and it must immediately precede hWndTarget in the outline, or this function will fail.
member.returns: The Label Control associated with the object that called this function.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalOptionButton.DisableWindowAndLabel
member.summary: Disables keyboard and mouse input to a window and grays out its associated label. A label is the label control that immediately precedes the window in the outline. The label control must have a mnemonic. If the window contains text (for example, a push button), the text is grayed. If the window is a data field, it cannot receive the focus.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if it fails.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalOptionButton.EnableWindowAndLabel
member.summary: Enables keyboard and mouse input to a window and enables its associated label as well. A label is the label control that immediately precedes the window in the outline.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if it fails.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalOptionButton.ShowWindowAndLabel
member.summary: Makes a window and its associated label visible. A label is the label control that immediately precedes the window in the outline.
member.returns: true if the previous state of the window was visible and false if it was hidden. Use this information to hide many windows without first checking that they are visible. When you restore them to their original state at a later point in time, the return lets you make visible only those windows that were previously visible.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalOptionButton.HideWindowAndLabel
member.summary: Hides a window and its associated label.
member.remarks: A label is the background text that immediately precedes the window in the outline. This function does not destroy the window; it only makes the window invisible.
member.returns: true if the previous state of the window was visible and false if it was hidden. Use this information to hide many windows without first checking that they are visible. When you restore them to their original state at a later point in time, the return lets you make visible only those windows that were previously visible.

member.summary: Inserts a file's contents into a picture.
member.remarks: Function SetImageFile() loads most picture formats. The file extension must match the format type. Valid files are of the following types:. .bmp(Windows bitmap files), .dib(Device Independent bitmaps, a holdover from earlier versions of Windows), .pcx, .tif(Tagged Image File Format(TIFF) files), .wmf(Windows MetaFile format), .gif(Graphics Interchange Format files).jpg(Joint Photographic Experts Group (JPEG) files)
member.param: The name of the file whose contents are to be inserted into the control
member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if it fails.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalPicture.SetContextMenu(PPJ.Runtime.SalString,PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber)
member.summary: Defines a named popup menu that displays automatically when a window receives SAM_ContextMenu.
member.remarks: For some windows, this function also affects how the window processes a right mouse button click: List box-Right click selects the line under the cursor.If the line is already selected, there is no effect. Combo box-For a combo box where the list is always displayed, the behavior is the same as for a list box. Table window-Right click selects the row under the cursor. If the row is already selected there is no effect.
member.param: A named menu defined in one of the Named Menus section in the control, its MDI window parent, or Global Declarations.
Set this to to replace the default menu that Windows displays when the mouse pointer is in an editable table window cell. Otherwise, set this to zero.
member.returns: true if this function succeeds and false otherwise.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalPicture.SetContextMenu(System.Type,PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber)

member.returns: true if this function succeeds and false otherwise.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalPicture.FormUnitsToPixels(PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber,PPJ.Runtime.SalBoolean)
member.summary: Computes the number of pixels in the number of form units. Form units are a unit of measurement used by functions which move and position objects. Form units are computed using physical units (pixels) in conjunction with the window's font size.
member.param: The number of form units.
If the form units are on the X axis, set this parameter to false. If the form units are on the Y axis, set this parameter to true.
member.returns: the number of pixels if the function succeeds. Returns zero (0) if the control is invalid.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalPicture.GetFirstChild(PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber)
member.summary: Returns the handle of the first child window of the specified type. You can use this function to get the handles of MDI child windows.

remarks.para: Window types:

and are statistics by default and not implemented as windows. If you want this function to work for lines and frames set the system variable bStaticsAsWindows to TRUE. This is a global system variable, so the setting persists until it is changed.

member.param: One or more window types combined (using the OR (|) operator) to create a mask of child window types.
member.returns: the first child window of the specified type. Returns if there is no child window or if the control is invalid.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalPicture.GetNextChild(PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber)
member.summary: Returns the handle of the next child window that matches a specified type.

remarks.para: Window types:

Use this function after calling GetFirstChild() to get the other child window siblings. You can use this function to get the handles of MDI child windows. If you want this function to work for lines and frames, set the system variable bStaticsAsWindows to true. This is a global system variable, so the setting persists until you change it.

member.param: One or more window types combined (using the OR (|) operator) to create a mask of child window types.
member.returns: the next child window of the specified type. Returns if there is no child window or if the window is invalid.

member.summary: Sets the text of a window.
member.remarks: A window's text is the title of a form window, modeless dialog box, table window, radio button, check box, or push button. For a data field or table window column, the text is the object's value in string form, regardless of the object's data type. For a combo box, the text is the contents of the editable data field portion.If the combo box is not editable, it tries to set the list selection to the item that matches the specified string. This latter statement is true for list boxes as well.
member.param: The window text.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if it fails.

member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if it fails.

member.summary: Creates pop-up menus at runtime.
member.remarks: Possible flag values:
member.param: The name of a pop-up menu accessible to the owner. For example, a menu defined by the owner or its MDI window parent, or a global menu.
Specifies how the pop-up menu displays. You can combine flag values using the OR (|) operator.
The position of the pop-up menu on the X axis. The value of this parameter is ignored if you set the flag in flags.

The position of the pop-up menu on the Y axis. The value of this parameter is ignored if you set the in flags. The x and y Parameters together represent a point (the top left, top middle, or top right) of the pop-up menu, depending on the flags value.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if it fails.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalPicture.UpdateWindow
member.summary: Forces the update of a window.
member.remarks: Painting is a low priority. Paint messages are sent to the end of an object's message queue and are processed after all other messages in the queue. If, during the development phase of your application, you find that painting is being delayed, you can force a window to update.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if the window is not valid.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalPicture.IsDerivedFromClass(System.Type)
member.summary: Determines whether a window is an instance of the specified class.
member.remarks: Tells you if a window is an instance of the class that you specify or an instance of a class that is derived from the class that you specify. Call this function to determine if you can make a late-bound call to a function defined in the named class using the window handle that you specify. If you make a late-bound function call with a handle that is not for a window derived from the named class and the function returns a value, you get an error at runtime and the application ends.
member.param: The class type. Not a string. Type the class name without single quotes.
member.returns: true if the window is an instance of the named class or an instance of a class that is derived from the named class.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalPicture.SetModified(PPJ.Runtime.SalBoolean)
member.summary: Sets or clears the field edit flag for an editable data field, combo box, multi line text field, table window column, or picture.
member.remarks: The Field Edit Flag is set whenever the user changes the value of a data field, multiline field, combo box or table window column. For a picture, the field edit flag is set whenever a server application is opened for editing. The field edit flag is not set if you make the change with a Set statement or a fetch from a database.
member.param: true sets the flag; false clears it.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if it fails.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalPicture.IsModified
member.summary: Returns the setting of the Field Edit Flag for a data field, multi line field, combo box, table window's context row cell, or picture.
member.remarks: The field edit flag is set whenever the user changes the value of an editable data field, multiline text field, or table window column. For a picture, the field edit flag is set whenever a server application is opened for editing. The field edit flag is not set if you make the change with a Set statement or a fetch from the database.
member.returns: true if the field edit flag is set and false otherwise.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalPicture.GetLabel
member.summary: Retrieves the window handle of the label (label control) that is associated with the object that called this function. There must be a mnemonic in that label, and it must immediately precede hWndTarget in the outline, or this function will fail.
member.returns: The Label Control associated with the object that called this function.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalPicture.DisableWindowAndLabel
member.summary: Disables keyboard and mouse input to a window and grays out its associated label. A label is the label control that immediately precedes the window in the outline. The label control must have a mnemonic. If the window contains text (for example, a push button), the text is grayed. If the window is a data field, it cannot receive the focus.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if it fails.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalPicture.EnableWindowAndLabel
member.summary: Enables keyboard and mouse input to a window and enables its associated label as well. A label is the label control that immediately precedes the window in the outline.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if it fails.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalPicture.ShowWindowAndLabel
member.summary: Makes a window and its associated label visible. A label is the label control that immediately precedes the window in the outline.
member.returns: true if the previous state of the window was visible and false if it was hidden. Use this information to hide many windows without first checking that they are visible. When you restore them to their original state at a later point in time, the return lets you make visible only those windows that were previously visible.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalPicture.HideWindowAndLabel
member.summary: Hides a window and its associated label.
member.remarks: A label is the background text that immediately precedes the window in the outline. This function does not destroy the window; it only makes the window invisible.
member.returns: true if the previous state of the window was visible and false if it was hidden. Use this information to hide many windows without first checking that they are visible. When you restore them to their original state at a later point in time, the return lets you make visible only those windows that were previously visible.

member.summary: Defines a named popup menu that displays automatically when a window receives .
member.remarks: For some windows, this function also affects how the window processes a right mouse button click: List box-Right click selects the line under the cursor.If the line is already selected, there is no effect. Combo box-For a combo box where the list is always displayed, the behavior is the same as for a list box. Table window-Right click selects the row under the cursor. If the row is already selected there is no effect.
member.param: A named menu defined in one of the Named Menus section in the control, its MDI window parent, or Global Declarations.
Set this to to replace the default menu that Windows displays when the mouse pointer is in an editable table window cell. Otherwise, set this to zero.
member.returns: true if this function succeeds and false otherwise.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalPushbutton.GetFirstChild(PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber)
member.summary: Returns the handle of the first child window of the specified type. You can use this function to get the handles of MDI child windows.

remarks.para: Window types:

and are statistics by default and not implemented as windows. If you want this function to work for lines and frames set the system variable bStaticsAsWindows to TRUE. This is a global system variable, so the setting persists until it is changed.

member.param: One or more window types combined (using the OR (|) operator) to create a mask of child window types.
member.returns: the first child window of the specified type. Returns if there is no child window or if the control is invalid.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalPushbutton.GetNextChild(PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber)
member.summary: Returns the handle of the next child window that matches a specified type.

remarks.para: Window types:

Use this function after calling GetFirstChild() to get the other child window siblings. You can use this function to get the handles of MDI child windows. If you want this function to work for lines and frames, set the system variable bStaticsAsWindows to true. This is a global system variable, so the setting persists until you change it.

member.param: One or more window types combined (using the OR (|) operator) to create a mask of child window types.
member.returns: the next child window of the specified type. Returns if there is no child window or if the control is invalid.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalPushbutton.PixelsToFormUnits(PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber,PPJ.Runtime.SalBoolean)
member.summary: Computes the number of form units based on the number of pixels. Form units are a unit of measurement used by functions that move and position objects. Form units are computed using physical units (pixels) in conjunction with a window's font sizes.
member.param: The number of pixels.
If the form units are on the X axis, set this parameter to false. If the form units are on the Y axis, set this parameter to true.
member.returns: the number of form units returned if the function call is successful. Returns zero (0) if the control is invalid.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalPushbutton.SetText(PPJ.Runtime.SalString)
member.summary: Sets the text of a window.
member.remarks: A window's text is the title of a form window, modeless dialog box, table window, radio button, check box, or push button. For a data field or table window column, the text is the object's value in string form, regardless of the object's data type. For a combo box, the text is the contents of the editable data field portion.If the combo box is not editable, it tries to set the list selection to the item that matches the specified string. This latter statement is true for list boxes as well. SetWindowText() clears the field edit flag.
member.param: The window text.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if it fails.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalPushbutton.ShowWindow
member.summary: Makes a window visible.
member.returns: true if the previous state of the window was visible and false if it was hidden. Use this information to hide many windows without first checking that they are visible. When you restore them to their original state at a later point in time, the return lets you make visible only those windows that were previously visible.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalPushbutton.KillTimer(PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber)
member.summary: Destroys an object's system timer.

member.returns: true if the event is successfully killed and false if the specified timer cannot be found.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalPushbutton.SetTimer(PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber,PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber)
member.summary: Creates a system timer for a given object. When a timer event occurs, sends messages to the object in specified intervals. Timers are a limited global resource. Your application must check the value returned by SetTimer() to verify that the timer was created.
member.param: The timer ID number.
The elapsed time between each message, in milliseconds.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if it fails.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalPushbutton.TrackPopupMenu(PPJ.Runtime.SalString,PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber,PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber,PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber)
member.summary: Creates pop-up menus at runtime.
member.remarks: Possible flag values:
member.param: The name of a pop-up menu accessible to the control.. For example, a menu defined by the contrpl or its MDI window parent, or a global menu.
Specifies how the pop-up menu displays. You can combine flag values using the OR (|) operator.
The position of the pop-up menu on the X axis. The value of this parameter is ignored if you set the flag in flags.

The position of the pop-up menu on the Y axis. The value of this parameter is ignored if you set the in flags. The x and y Parameters together represent a point (the top left, top middle, or top right) of the pop-up menu, depending on the flags value.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if it fails.

The position of the pop-up menu on the Y axis. The value of this parameter is ignored if you set the in flags. The x and y Parameters together represent a point (the top left, top middle, or top right) of the pop-up menu, depending on the flags value.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalPushbutton.UpdateWindow
member.summary: Forces the update of a window.
member.remarks: Painting is a low priority. Paint messages are sent to the end of an object's message queue and are processed after all other messages in the queue. If, during the development phase of your application, you find that painting is being delayed, you can force a window to update.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if the control is not a valid window.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalPushbutton.IsDerivedFromClass(System.Type)
member.summary: Determines whether a window is an instance of the specified class.
member.remarks: Tells you if a window is an instance of the class that you specify or an instance of a class that is derived from the class that you specify. Call this function to determine if you can make a late-bound call to a function defined in the named class using the window handle that you specify. If you make a late-bound function call with a handle that is not for a window derived from the named class and the function returns a value, you get an error at runtime and the application ends.
member.param: The class type. Not a string. Type the class name without single quotes.
member.returns: true if the window is an instance of the named class or an instance of a class that is derived from the named class.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalPushbutton.SetModified(PPJ.Runtime.SalBoolean)
member.summary: Sets or clears the field edit flag for an editable data field, combo box, multi line text field, table window column, or picture.
member.remarks: The Field Edit Flag is set whenever the user changes the value of a data field, multiline field, combo box or table window column. For a picture, the field edit flag is set whenever a server application is opened for editing. The field edit flag is not set if you make the change with a Set statement or a fetch from a database.
member.param: true sets the flag; false clears it.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if it fails.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalPushbutton.IsModified
member.summary: Returns the setting of the Field Edit Flag for a data field, multi line field, combo box, table window's context row cell, or picture.

remarks.para: The field edit flag is set whenever the user changes the value of an editable data field, multiline text field, or table window column. For a picture, the field edit flag is set whenever a server application is opened for editing. The field edit flag is not set if you make the change with a Set statement or a fetch from the database.
This function does NOT clear the field edit flag of the control.

member.returns: true if the control's field edit flag is set and false otherwise.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalPushbutton.GetLabel
member.summary: Retrieves the window handle of the label (label control) that is associated with the hWndTarget parameter. There must be a mnemonic in that label, and it must immediately precede hWndTarget in the outline, or this function will fail.
member.returns: The Label Control associated with the control

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalPushbutton.DisableWindowAndLabel
member.summary: Disables keyboard and mouse input to a window and grays out its associated label. A label is the label control that immediately precedes the window in the outline. The label control must have a mnemonic. If the window contains text (for example, a push button), the text is grayed. If the window is a data field, it cannot receive the focus.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if it fails.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalPushbutton.EnableWindowAndLabel
member.summary: Enables keyboard and mouse input to a window and enables its associated label as well. A label is the label control that immediately precedes the window in the outline.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if it fails.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalPushbutton.ShowWindowAndLabel
member.summary: Makes a window and its associated label visible. A label is the label control that immediately precedes the window in the outline.
member.returns: true if the previous state of the window was visible and false if it was hidden. Use this information to hide many windows without first checking that they are visible. When you restore them to their original state at a later point in time, the return lets you make visible only those windows that were previously visible.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalPushbutton.HideWindowAndLabel
member.summary: Hides a window and its associated label.
member.remarks: A label is the background text that immediately precedes the window in the outline. This function does not destroy the window; it only makes the window invisible.
member.returns: true if the previous state of the window was visible and false if it was hidden. Use this information to hide many windows without first checking that they are visible. When you restore them to their original state at a later point in time, the return lets you make visible only those windows that were previously visible.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalRadioButton.SetContextMenu(PPJ.Runtime.SalString,PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber)
member.summary: Defines a named popup menu that displays automatically when a window receives .
member.remarks: For some windows, this function also affects how the window processes a right mouse button click: List box-Right click selects the line under the cursor.If the line is already selected, there is no effect. Combo box-For a combo box where the list is always displayed, the behavior is the same as for a list box. Table window-Right click selects the row under the cursor. If the row is already selected there is no effect.
member.param: A named menu defined in one of the Named Menus section in the control, its MDI window parent, or Global Declarations.
Set this to to replace the default menu that Windows displays when the mouse pointer is in an editable table window cell. Otherwise, set this to zero.
member.returns: true if this function succeeds and false otherwise.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalRadioButton.IsDerivedFromClass(System.Type)
member.summary: Determines whether a window is an instance of the specified class.
member.remarks: Tells you if a window is an instance of the class that you specify or an instance of a class that is derived from the class that you specify. Call this function to determine if you can make a late-bound call to a function defined in the named class using the window handle that you specify. If you make a late-bound function call with a handle that is not for a window derived from the named class and the function returns a value, you get an error at runtime and the application ends.
member.param: The class type. Not a string. Type the class name without single quotes.
member.returns: true if the window is an instance of the named class or an instance of a class that is derived from the named class.

member.summary: Sets or clears the field edit flag for an editable data field, combo box, multi line text field, table window column, or picture.
member.remarks: The Field Edit Flag is set whenever the user changes the value of a data field, multiline field, combo box or table window column. member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalRadioButton.DisableWindowAndLabel
member.summary: Disables keyboard and mouse input to a window and grays out its associated label. A label is the label control that immediately precedes the window in the outline. When you restore them to their original state at a later point in time, the return lets you make visible only those windows that were previously visible.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalRadioButton.HideWindowAndLabel

member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if it fails.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalUserControl.SetContextMenu(PPJ.Runtime.SalString,PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber)
member.summary: Defines a named popup menu that displays automatically when a window receives .
member.remarks: For some windows, this function also affects how the window processes a right mouse button click: List box-Right click selects the line under the cursor.If the line is already selected, there is no effect. Combo box-For a combo box where the list is always displayed, the behavior is the same as for a list box. Table window-Right click selects the row under the cursor. If the row is already selected there is no effect.
member.param: A named menu defined in one of the Named Menus section in the control, its MDI window parent, or Global Declarations.
Set this to to replace the default menu that Windows displays when the mouse pointer is in an editable table window cell. Otherwise, set this to zero.
member.returns: true if this function succeeds and false otherwise.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalUserControl.SetContextMenu(System.Type,PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber)
member.summary: Defines a named popup menu that displays automatically when a window receives SAM_ContextMenu.
member.param: the of the menu
Set this to to replace the default menu that Windows displays when the mouse pointer is in an editable table window cell. Otherwise, set this to zero.
member.returns: true if this function succeeds and false otherwise.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalUserControl.DestroyWindow

member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if it fails.

member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if it fails.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalUserControl.EnableWindow
member.summary: Enables keyboard and mouse input to a window.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalUserControl.FormUnitsToPixels(PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber,PPJ.Runtime.SalBoolean)
member.summary: Computes the number of pixels in the number of form units. Form units are a unit of measurement used by functions which move and position objects. Form units are computed using physical units (pixels) in conjunction with the window's font size.
member.param: The number of form units.
If the form units are on the X axis, set this parameter to false. If the form units are on the Y axis, set this parameter to true.
member.returns: the number of pixels if the function succeeds. Returns zero (0) if the control is invalid.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalUserControl.GetFirstChild(PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber)
member.summary: Returns the handle of the first child window of the specified type. You can use this function to get the handles of MDI child windows.

remarks.para: Window types:

and are statistics by default and not implemented as windows. If you want this function to work for lines and frames set the system variable bStaticsAsWindows to TRUE. This is a global system variable, so the setting persists until it is changed.

member.param: One or more window types combined (using the OR (|) operator) to create a mask of child window types.
member.returns: the first child window of the specified type. Returns if there is no child window or if the control is invalid.

member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if it fails.

member.summary: Gets the name of an object.
member.returns: the name of the object.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalUserControl.GetNextChild(PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber)
member.summary: Returns the handle of the next child window that matches a specified type.

remarks.para: Window types:

Use this function after calling GetFirstChild() to get the other child window siblings. You can use this function to get the handles of MDI child windows. If you want this function to work for lines and frames, set the system variable bStaticsAsWindows to true. This is a global system variable, so the setting persists until you change it.

member.param: One or more window types combined (using the OR (|) operator) to create a mask of child window types.
member.returns: the next child window of the specified type. Returns if there is no child window or if the control is invalid.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalUserControl.SetText(PPJ.Runtime.SalString)
member.summary: Sets the text of a window.
member.remarks: A window's text is the title of a form window, modeless dialog box, table window, radio button, check box, or push button. For a data field or table window column, the text is the object's value in string form, regardless of the object's data type. For a combo box, the text is the contents of the editable data field portion.If the combo box is not editable, it tries to set the list selection to the item that matches the specified string. This latter statement is true for list boxes as well. SetWindowText() clears the field edit flag.
member.param: The window text.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if it fails.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalUserControl.ShowWindow
member.summary: Makes a window visible.
member.returns: true if the previous state of the window was visible and false if it was hidden. Use this information to hide many windows without first checking that they are visible. When you restore them to their original state at a later point in time, the return lets you make visible only those windows that were previously visible.

members.member:
Destroys an object's system timer.
Set a system timer with the function. Note: Timers are a limited global resource. Your application must check the value returned by to verify that the timer was created.
The timer ID to kill./param> true if the event is successfully killed and false if the specified timer cannot be found.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalUserControl.SetTimer(PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber,PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber)
member.summary: Creates a system timer for a given object. When a timer event occurs, sends messages to the object in specified intervals. Timers are a limited global resource. Your application must check the value returned by SetTimer() to verify that the timer was created.
member.param: The timer ID number.
The elapsed time between each message, in milliseconds.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if it fails.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalUserControl.TrackPopupMenu(PPJ.Runtime.SalString,PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber,PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber,PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber)
member.summary: Creates pop-up menus at runtime.
member.remarks: Possible flag values:
member.param: The name of a pop-up menu accessible to the control.. For example, a menu defined by the contrpl or its MDI window parent, or a global menu.
Specifies how the pop-up menu displays. You can combine flag values using the OR (|) operator.
The position of the pop-up menu on the X axis. The value of this parameter is ignored if you set the flag in flags.

The position of the pop-up menu on the Y axis. The value of this parameter is ignored if you set the in flags. The x and y Parameters together represent a point (the top left, top middle, or top right) of the pop-up menu, depending on the flags value.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if it fails.

The position of the pop-up menu on the X axis. The value of this parameter is ignored if you set the flag in flags.

The position of the pop-up menu on the Y axis. The value of this parameter is ignored if you set the in flags. The x and y Parameters together represent a point (the top left, top middle, or top right) of the pop-up menu, depending on the flags value.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if it fails.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalUserControl.UpdateWindow
member.summary: Forces the update of a window.
member.remarks: Painting is a low priority. Paint messages are sent to the end of an object's message queue and are processed after all other messages in the queue. If, during the development phase of your application, you find that painting is being delayed, you can force a window to update.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if the control is not a valid window.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalUserControl.IsDerivedFromClass(System.Type)
member.summary: Determines whether a window is an instance of the specified class.
member.remarks: Tells you if a window is an instance of the class that you specify or an instance of a class that is derived from the class that you specify. Call this function to determine if you can make a late-bound call to a function defined in the named class using the window handle that you specify. If you make a late-bound function call with a handle that is not for a window derived from the named class and the function returns a value, you get an error at runtime and the application ends.
member.param: The class type. Not a string. Type the class name without single quotes.
member.returns: true if the window is an instance of the named class or an instance of a class that is derived from the named class.

For a combo box, the text is the contents of the editable data field portion.If the combo box is not editable, it tries to set the list selection to the item that matches the specified string. member.param: The name of a pop-up menu accessible to the control.. For example, a menu defined by the contrpl or its MDI window parent, or a global menu.
Specifies how the pop-up menu displays. You can combine flag values using the OR (|) operator.
The position of the pop-up menu on the X axis. The value of this parameter is ignored if you set the flag in flags.

The position of the pop-up menu on the Y axis. The value of this parameter is ignored if you set the in flags. The x and y Parameters together represent a point (the top left, top middle, or top right) of the pop-up menu, depending on the flags value.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalVerticalScrollBar.IsDerivedFromClass(System.Type)
member.summary: Determines whether a window is an instance of the specified class.
member.remarks: Tells you if a window is an instance of the class that you specify or an instance of a class that is derived from the class that you specify. Call this function to determine if you can make a late-bound call to a function defined in the named class using the window handle that you specify. If you make a late-bound function call with a handle that is not for a window derived from the named class and the function returns a value, you get an error at runtime and the application ends.
member.param: The class type. Not a string. Type the class name without single quotes.
member.returns: true if the window is an instance of the named class or an instance of a class that is derived from the named class.

member.summary: Sets or clears the field edit flag for an editable data field, combo box, multi line text field, table window column, or picture.
member.remarks: The Field Edit Flag is set whenever the user changes the value of a data field, multiline field, combo box or table window column. For a picture, the field edit flag is set whenever a server application is opened for editing. The field edit flag is not set if you make the change with a Set statement or a fetch from a database.

member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if it fails.

member.summary: Returns the setting of the Field Edit Flag for a data field, multi line field, combo box, table window's context row cell, or picture.

For a picture, the field edit flag is set whenever a server application is opened for editing. The field edit flag is not set if you make the change with a Set statement or a fetch from the database.
This function does NOT clear the field edit flag of the control.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalVerticalScrollBar.DisableWindowAndLabel
member.summary: Disables keyboard and mouse input to a window and grays out its associated label. A label is the label control that immediately precedes the window in the outline. When you restore them to their original state at a later point in time, the return lets you make visible only those windows that were previously visible.

member.summary: Gets a scroll bar's scroll range, line increment, and page increment.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalVerticalScrollBar.SetScrollBarPosition(PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber)
member.summary: Sets the scrollbar's value.
member.remarks: This function is equivalent to using a Set statement to assign a value to the scroll bar.
member.param: The scroll bar position. If this value is outside the scroll bar's range, sets the scroll bar position to the scroll range minimum or the scroll range maximum, depending on whether is below or above the range.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if it fails.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalVerticalScrollBar.SetScrollBarRange(PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber,PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber,PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber,PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber)
member.summary: Sets a scroll bar's range, line increment, and page increment. When the scroll bar is created, assigns it these values: Minimum scroll position0 Maximum scroll position100 Line Increment1 Page Increment10 If the scroll bar's current position is outside the new range, its position changes to one within the new range. The range of a scroll bar is -32,767 to 32,767.

remarks.para: When the scroll bar is created, it is assigned these values:
Minimum scroll position: 0
Maximum scroll position: 100
Line Increment: 1
Page Increment: 10

If the scroll bar's position before calling this function is outside the range specified by and , its position changes to fall within the new range. and must lie within the range of -32,767 to 32,767.

member.param: The minimum position of the scroll bar.
The maximum position of the scroll bar.
The number of units to increment or decrement the scroll bar when the user clicks the scroll bar arrow.
The number of units to increment or decrement the scroll bar when the user clicks either side of the scroll box.
member.returns: true if the function succeeds and false if it fails.

Looks like Microsoft forgot to add the 0x10 (SWP_NOACTIVATE) flag when bringing the form on top using SetWindowPos in Control.OnWmCreate()->UpdateChildZOrder(), causing WM_ACTIVATE to be generated while processing WM_CREATE.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalForm.GetOwner(System.Windows.Forms.Control,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Returns the owner control to be used for creating the form or the dialog. Applies CTD's strange rules:
- if the parent is a form, the owner is the form - if the parent is a mdi child form, the owner is the mdi parent - if the parent is a child form, the owner is the top level control - if the parent is a child control, the owner is the top level control
Additionally, if ultimately the rules above result in null, the owner is reverted to the specified parent. This is not CTD behavior, but it's needed for apps that use embedded forms as owners of dialogs/forms.

member.name: P:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalFormTableWindow.AllowFiltering
member.summary: Enables/Disables the excel-style filtering feature.

remarks.para: Set the property to true to be able to use the type-specific filters, otherwise the filters operate on the displayed value.
When using native types in conjunction with a non-standard format or an edit mask that cannot be parsed to a native value, it is possible to lose the edited value when it cannot be parsed.

member.name: P:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalFormTableWindow.UseNativeTypes
member.summary: Returns or sets whether the grid tries to parse the edited value into the native type of the column.

remarks.para: When using native types in conjunction with a non-standard format or an edit mask that cannot be parsed to a native value, it is possible to lose the edited value when it cannot be parsed.

member.name: F:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.QO.QO.TABSM_First
member.summary: High level messages NOTE: These messages are provided for backward compatibility. This version of QuickTabs also calls late bound functions in the parent form or dialog box when an event occurs.

member.name: F:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.QO.QO.TABSM_Create
member.summary: In the actions of a tab frame, use this message instead of SAM_Create to insure proper tab frame initialization. TabCreate( hWnd ) is the equivalent late bound function call.

member.name: F:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.QO.QO.TABSM_UserRequest
member.summary: Indicates that user is attempting to change the current tab by clicking, tabbing or some other user action. wParam - Index of the selected tab lParam - Not used NOTE: Call CancelMode() to deny the user's request. TabUserRequest( nTab ) is the equivalent late bound function call.

member.name: F:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.QO.QO.TABSM_TabActivateStart
member.summary: Indicates that a tab has been activated. wParam - Index of the selected tab lParam - Not used This message is sent before child windows are shown. TabActivateStart( nTab ) is the equivalent late bound function call.

member.name: F:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.QO.QO.TABSM_TabActivateFinish
member.summary: Indicates that a tab has been activated. wParam - Index of the selected tab lParam - Not used This message is sent after the child windows have been shown. TabActivateFinish is the equivalent late bound function call.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.QO.SalQuickTabs.SetCurrentPage(PPJ.Runtime.SalString)
member.summary: Activates a page. Causes the form page associated to the specified tab to be created and/or shown. The current form page will be hidden.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.QO.SalQuickTabs.GetPageWindow(PPJ.Runtime.SalString)
member.summary: Get the window of a page. Call this function to get the Window Handle of a page. The return value is the Window Handle of the page. hWndNULL is returned if the page window has not been created.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.QO.SalQuickTabs.ReloadTabs
member.summary: Reloads the original tabs configuration.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.QO.SalQuickTabs.SetWorkspaceBoundary(PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber,PPJ.Runtime.SalNumber)
member.summary: Define the boundaries of the workspace so that a tiled-to-parent tab frame won't be resized smaller than this boundary.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.QO.SalQuickTabs.FindPage(PPJ.Runtime.SalString)
member.summary: Returns the FormPage instance associated to the specified tab name.

member.summary: Let a page form initialize itself

member.summary: Let a page form apply its changes

member.summary: Let a page form know that it has been hidden

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.QO.SalQuickTabsDialog.ProcessDialogKey(System.Windows.Forms.Keys)
member.summary:
Processes Control+Tab to change the current tab also when the focus is on a different control.
Doesn't process Accept and Cancel buttons on hidden controls. PPJ controls should process mnemonics when hidden unless they are hidden because they are bound to a tab page.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalApplication.RemoveForm(System.Windows.Forms.Form)
member.summary:
Decreases the reference count for the application object. When the count drops to zero (or below if there is a bug), the application exits. It is called every time a Sal form is destroyed.
This should emulate SAL application's behavior with respect to top level windows. When the last form is destroyed the app exits.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalApplication.SetProfileString(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Set the value of an entry in the specified section of an initialization file or registry. All profile information is stored as string, so if you want to store an integer it must be converted to a string first. Then it can be retrieved as an integer using the SalGetProfileInt- Function .
member.param: The section heading.
The entry whose associated value is being set.
The value of sEntry.

The name of the initialization file or company name depending on the settings made using the SalUseRegistry function. If you are searching for an INI file and do not specify the full path, searches for the file in the Windows subdirectory.
member.returns: bOk

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalApplication.UseRegistry(System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: This function is used to re-direct all SalProfile* functions to use the Registry. All values for the SalProfile* functions are saved as strings. The INI file name used as the last parameter of the SalProfile* functions will be used as the application name. The resulting path will be: \\HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\<company name>\<application name>\<section>\<setting>\
member.returns: bOk

member.summary: Allows tracing to begin.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalApplication.EndTrace
member.summary: Stops all tracing. Any calls to SalTrace() occurring after SalEndTrace() will be ignored.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalApplication.Trace(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Outputs a string to the trace output target selected earlier in the SalStartTrace function. Note that if tracing is not already activated, this function will return TRUE even though no trace action is taken. When writing to the event log, the severity level is kept in numeric form. When writing to any other output target, it is translated into a text string such as "Warning".

member.name: P:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalWindow.DisableMessages
member.summary:
Enables/Disables the dispatching of Windows messages to the SAL MessageActions handler.
This is used to suppress message dispatching when there is a potential recursive loop that will cause a stack overflow. For example, when setting the cursor .NET causes the WM_SETCURSOR message to be sent which might cause stack overflow if the function was originally called in response to WM_SETCURSOR.

member.summary: Returns the system's dpi scale factor.

member.summary: Returns whether the ScaleForm() method is performing the scaling procedure because of a DPI or Font change.

member.summary: Processes windows messages for SAL controls.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalWindow.DispatchThenProcess(System.Windows.Forms.Message@)
member.summary: Dispatch the message to MessageActions and then process in the WndProc.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalWindow.ProcessThenDispatch(System.Windows.Forms.Message@)
member.summary: Process in WndProc first (to give .NET a chance to update the control's properties) and then dispatch to MessageActions.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalWindow.WmNcCreate(System.Windows.Forms.Message@)
member.summary: Detect design mode on WM_NCCREATE, before any other message gets dispatched.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalWindow.WmClose(System.Windows.Forms.Message@)
member.summary:
Process WM_CLOSE by sending SAM_Close first to the application. SAM_Close is exactly the same as WM_CLOSE (only message in CTD) so we don't dispatch the original Windows message.
Additionally CTD destroys a child controls that receives WM_CLOSE, while .NET (and Windows in general) doesn't. So here we translated WM_CLOSE to WM_DESTROY if it is sent to a child control.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalWindow.WmDestroy(System.Windows.Forms.Message@)
member.summary: WM_DESTROY must be processed before the .NET framework, otherwise all the members of the controls instance are cleared in the OnHandleDestroyed handler.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalWindow.WmSetFocus(System.Windows.Forms.Message@)
member.summary: WM_SETFOCUS and WM_KILLFOCUS need to be handled here because the .NET framework does not keep track of the wParam (window losing and gaining the focus).

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalWindow.WmKillFocus(System.Windows.Forms.Message@)
member.summary: WM_SETFOCUS and WM_KILLFOCUS need to be handled here because the .NET framework does not keep track of the wParam (window losing and gaining the focus).

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalWindow.WmContextMenu(System.Windows.Forms.Message@)
member.summary: WM_CONTEXTMENU is translated to SAM_ContextMenu. If the form does not process SAM_ContextMenu, the default ContextMenu .NET implementation is invoked.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalTableColumn.DisableWindowAndLabel
member.summary: Disables keyboard and mouse input to a window and grays out its associated label. A label is the label control that immediately precedes the window in the outline. The label control must have a mnemonic. If the window contains text (for example, a push button), the text is grayed. If the window is a data field, it cannot receive the focus.

member.summary: Makes a window and its associated label visible. A label is the label control that immediately precedes the window in the outline.

member.name: M:PPJ.Runtime.Windows.SalTableColumn.PopulateList(PPJ.Runtime.Sql.SalSqlHandle,PPJ.Runtime.SalString)
member.summary: Populates a list box or combo box with a result set. SalListPopulate overrides any settings made with SalListSetTabs. If the SELECT statement returns data from multiple columns, each column's data displayed in a list box is separated by tabs. However, due to a Microsoft Windows limitation, each column's data displayed in a combo box is separated by a single '|' character. There is no space between one column's data, the separator character, and another column's data.

There is no space between one column's data, the separator character, and another column's data.
